57#define MDB_PID_T int
58#define MDB_THR_T DWORD
59#include <sys/types.h>
60#include <sys/stat.h>
61#ifdef __GNUC__
62# include <sys/param.h>
63#else
64# define LITTLE_ENDIAN 1234
65# define BIG_ENDIAN 4321
66# define BYTE_ORDER LITTLE_ENDIAN
67# ifndef SSIZE_MAX
68# define SSIZE_MAX INT_MAX
69# endif
70#endif
71#else
72#include <sys/types.h>
73#include <sys/stat.h>
74#define MDB_PID_T pid_t
75#define MDB_THR_T pthread_t
76#include <sys/param.h>
77#include <sys/uio.h>

80#include <sys/file.h>
81#endif
82#include <fcntl.h>
83#endif

85#if defined(__mips) && defined(__linux)
86/* MIPS has cache coherency issues, requires explicit cache control */
87#include <asm/cachectl.h>
88extern int cacheflush(char *addr, int nbytes, int cache);
89#define CACHEFLUSH(addr, bytes, cache) cacheflush(addr, bytes, cache)
90#else
91#define CACHEFLUSH(addr, bytes, cache)
92#endif

94#if defined(__linux) && !defined(MDB_FDATASYNC_WORKS)
100#define BROKEN_FDATASYNC

122#if defined(__sun) || defined(ANDROID)
123/* Most platforms have posix_memalign, older may only have memalign */
124#define HAVE_MEMALIGN 1

127#if defined (__sun)
128# define _POSIX_PTHREAD_SEMANTICS 1
129#endif

137#if defined(__FreeBSD__) && defined(__FreeBSD_version) && __FreeBSD_version >= 1100110
138# define MDB_USE_POSIX_MUTEX 1
139# define MDB_USE_ROBUST 1
140#elif defined(__APPLE__) || defined (BSD) || defined(__FreeBSD_kernel__)
141# define MDB_USE_POSIX_SEM 1
142# define MDB_FDATASYNC fsync
143#elif defined(ANDROID)
144# define MDB_FDATASYNC fsync
145#endif

154#define MDB_USE_POSIX_MUTEX 1
155#endif
156#endif

159 + defined(MDB_USE_POSIX_MUTEX) != 1
160# error "Ambiguous shared-lock implementation"
161#endif

163#ifdef USE_VALGRIND
164#include <valgrind/memcheck.h>
165#define VGMEMP_CREATE(h,r,z) VALGRIND_CREATE_MEMPOOL(h,r,z)
166#define VGMEMP_ALLOC(h,a,s) VALGRIND_MEMPOOL_ALLOC(h,a,s)
167#define VGMEMP_FREE(h,a) VALGRIND_MEMPOOL_FREE(h,a)
168#define VGMEMP_DESTROY(h) VALGRIND_DESTROY_MEMPOOL(h)
169#define VGMEMP_DEFINED(a,s) VALGRIND_MAKE_MEM_DEFINED(a,s)
170#else
171#define VGMEMP_CREATE(h,r,z)
172#define VGMEMP_ALLOC(h,a,s)
173#define VGMEMP_FREE(h,a)
174#define VGMEMP_DESTROY(h)
175#define VGMEMP_DEFINED(a,s)
176#endif

178#ifndef BYTE_ORDER
179# if (defined(_LITTLE_ENDIAN) || defined(_BIG_ENDIAN)) && !(defined(_LITTLE_ENDIAN) && defined(_BIG_ENDIAN))
180/* Solaris just defines one or the other */
181# define LITTLE_ENDIAN 1234
182# define BIG_ENDIAN 4321
183# ifdef _LITTLE_ENDIAN
184# define BYTE_ORDER LITTLE_ENDIAN
185# else
186# define BYTE_ORDER BIG_ENDIAN
187# endif
188# else
189# define BYTE_ORDER __BYTE_ORDER
190# endif
191#endif
192
193#ifndef LITTLE_ENDIAN
194#define LITTLE_ENDIAN __LITTLE_ENDIAN
195#endif
196#ifndef BIG_ENDIAN
197#define BIG_ENDIAN __BIG_ENDIAN
198#endif

200#if defined(__i386) || defined(__x86_64) || defined(_M_IX86)
201#define MISALIGNED_OK 1
202#endif

204#include "lmdb.h"
205#include "midl.h"
206
207#if (BYTE_ORDER == LITTLE_ENDIAN) == (BYTE_ORDER == BIG_ENDIAN)
208# error "Unknown or unsupported endianness (BYTE_ORDER)"
209#elif (-6 & 5) || CHAR_BIT != 8 || UINT_MAX < 0xffffffff || ULONG_MAX % 0xFFFF
210# error "Two's complement, reasonably sized integer types, please"
211#endif

217# else

219# endif
220#else
221#define ESECT
222#endif

242#ifndef MDB_DEVEL
243#define MDB_DEVEL 0
244#endif
245
247#if __STDC_VERSION__ >= 199901L
248# define mdb_func_ __func__
249#elif __GNUC__ >= 2 || _MSC_VER >= 1300
250# define mdb_func_ __FUNCTION__
251#else
252/* If a debug message says <mdb_unknown>(), update the #if statements above */
253# define mdb_func_ "<mdb_unknown>"
254#endif
255
256/* Internal error codes, not exposed outside liblmdb */
257#define MDB_NO_ROOT (MDB_LAST_ERRCODE + 10)
258#ifdef _WIN32
259#define MDB_OWNERDEAD ((int) WAIT_ABANDONED)
260#elif defined(MDB_USE_POSIX_MUTEX) && defined(EOWNERDEAD)
261#define MDB_OWNERDEAD EOWNERDEAD
262#endif
263
264#ifdef __GLIBC__
265#define GLIBC_VER ((__GLIBC__ << 16 )| __GLIBC_MINOR__)
266#endif
274#ifndef MDB_USE_ROBUST
275/* Android currently lacks Robust Mutex support. So does glibc < 2.4. */
276# if defined(MDB_USE_POSIX_MUTEX) && (defined(ANDROID) || \
277 (defined(__GLIBC__) && GLIBC_VER < 0x020004))
278# define MDB_USE_ROBUST 0
279# else
280# define MDB_USE_ROBUST 1
281# endif
282#endif /* !MDB_USE_ROBUST */
283
284#if defined(MDB_USE_POSIX_MUTEX) && (MDB_USE_ROBUST)
285/* glibc < 2.12 only provided _np API */
286# if (defined(__GLIBC__) && GLIBC_VER < 0x02000c) || \
287 (defined(PTHREAD_MUTEX_ROBUST_NP) && !defined(PTHREAD_MUTEX_ROBUST))
288# define PTHREAD_MUTEX_ROBUST PTHREAD_MUTEX_ROBUST_NP
289# define pthread_mutexattr_setrobust(attr, flag) pthread_mutexattr_setrobust_np(attr, flag)
290# define pthread_mutex_consistent(mutex) pthread_mutex_consistent_np(mutex)
291# endif
292#endif /* MDB_USE_POSIX_MUTEX && MDB_USE_ROBUST */
293
294#if defined(MDB_OWNERDEAD) && (MDB_USE_ROBUST)
295#define MDB_ROBUST_SUPPORTED 1
296#endif
297
298#ifdef _WIN32
299#define MDB_USE_HASH 1
300#define MDB_PIDLOCK 0
301#define THREAD_RET DWORD
302#define pthread_t HANDLE
303#define pthread_mutex_t HANDLE
304#define pthread_cond_t HANDLE
305typedef HANDLE mdb_mutex_t, mdb_mutexref_t;
306#define pthread_key_t DWORD
307#define pthread_self() GetCurrentThreadId()
308#define pthread_key_create(x,y) \
309 ((*(x) = TlsAlloc()) == TLS_OUT_OF_INDEXES ? ErrCode() : 0)
310#define pthread_key_delete(x) TlsFree(x)
311#define pthread_getspecific(x) TlsGetValue(x)
312#define pthread_setspecific(x,y) (TlsSetValue(x,y) ? 0 : ErrCode())
313#define pthread_mutex_unlock(x) ReleaseMutex(*x)
314#define pthread_mutex_lock(x) WaitForSingleObject(*x, INFINITE)
315#define pthread_cond_signal(x) SetEvent(*x)
316#define pthread_cond_wait(cond,mutex) do{SignalObjectAndWait(*mutex, *cond, INFINITE, FALSE); WaitForSingleObject(*mutex, INFINITE);}while(0)
317#define THREAD_CREATE(thr,start,arg) \
318 (((thr) = CreateThread(NULL, 0, start, arg, 0, NULL)) ? 0 : ErrCode())
319#define THREAD_FINISH(thr) \
320 (WaitForSingleObject(thr, INFINITE) ? ErrCode() : 0)
321#define LOCK_MUTEX0(mutex) WaitForSingleObject(mutex, INFINITE)
322#define UNLOCK_MUTEX(mutex) ReleaseMutex(mutex)
323#define mdb_mutex_consistent(mutex) 0
324#define getpid() GetCurrentProcessId()
325#define MDB_FDATASYNC(fd) (!FlushFileBuffers(fd))
326#define MDB_MSYNC(addr,len,flags) (!FlushViewOfFile(addr,len))
327#define ErrCode() GetLastError()
328#define GET_PAGESIZE(x) {SYSTEM_INFO si; GetSystemInfo(&si); (x) = si.dwPageSize;}
329#define close(fd) (CloseHandle(fd) ? 0 : -1)
330#define munmap(ptr,len) UnmapViewOfFile(ptr)
331#ifdef PROCESS_QUERY_LIMITED_INFORMATION
332#define MDB_PROCESS_QUERY_LIMITED_INFORMATION PROCESS_QUERY_LIMITED_INFORMATION
333#else
334#define MDB_PROCESS_QUERY_LIMITED_INFORMATION 0x1000
335#endif
336#define Z "I"
337#else
338#define THREAD_RET void *
339#define THREAD_CREATE(thr,start,arg) pthread_create(&thr,NULL,start,arg)
340#define THREAD_FINISH(thr) pthread_join(thr,NULL)
341#define Z "z"
344#define MDB_PIDLOCK 1
345
346#ifdef MDB_USE_POSIX_SEM
347
348typedef sem_t *mdb_mutex_t, *mdb_mutexref_t;
349#define LOCK_MUTEX0(mutex) mdb_sem_wait(mutex)
350#define UNLOCK_MUTEX(mutex) sem_post(mutex)
351
352static int
353mdb_sem_wait(sem_t *sem)
354{
355 int rc;
356 while ((rc = sem_wait(sem)) && (rc = errno) == EINTR) ;
357 return rc;
358}
359
360#else /* MDB_USE_POSIX_MUTEX: */
367typedef pthread_mutex_t mdb_mutex_t[1];
369typedef pthread_mutex_t *mdb_mutexref_t;
373#define LOCK_MUTEX0(mutex) pthread_mutex_lock(mutex)
376#define UNLOCK_MUTEX(mutex) pthread_mutex_unlock(mutex)
379#define mdb_mutex_consistent(mutex) pthread_mutex_consistent(mutex)
380#endif /* MDB_USE_POSIX_SEM */
381
384#define ErrCode() errno
385
390#define HANDLE int
391
396#define INVALID_HANDLE_VALUE (-1)
397
402#define GET_PAGESIZE(x) ((x) = sysconf(_SC_PAGE_SIZE))
403#endif
404
405#if defined(_WIN32) || defined(MDB_USE_POSIX_SEM)
406#define MNAME_LEN 32
407#else
408#define MNAME_LEN (sizeof(pthread_mutex_t))
409#endif
410
413#ifdef MDB_ROBUST_SUPPORTED
417#define LOCK_MUTEX(rc, env, mutex) \
418 (((rc) = LOCK_MUTEX0(mutex)) && \
419 ((rc) = mdb_mutex_failed(env, mutex, rc)))
420static int mdb_mutex_failed(MDB_env *env, mdb_mutexref_t mutex, int rc);
421#else
422#define LOCK_MUTEX(rc, env, mutex) ((rc) = LOCK_MUTEX0(mutex))
423#define mdb_mutex_failed(env, mutex, rc) (rc)
424#endif
425
426#ifndef _WIN32
435#ifndef MDB_DSYNC
436# ifdef O_DSYNC
437# define MDB_DSYNC O_DSYNC
438# else
439# define MDB_DSYNC O_SYNC
440# endif
441#endif
442#endif
443
447#ifndef MDB_FDATASYNC
448# define MDB_FDATASYNC fdatasync
449#endif
450
451#ifndef MDB_MSYNC
452# define MDB_MSYNC(addr,len,flags) msync(addr,len,flags)
453#endif
454
455#ifndef MS_SYNC
456#define MS_SYNC 1
457#endif
458
459#ifndef MS_ASYNC
460#define MS_ASYNC 0
461#endif
462
471typedef MDB_ID pgno_t;
472
476typedef MDB_ID txnid_t;
477
481#ifndef MDB_DEBUG
486#define MDB_DEBUG 0
487#endif
488
489#if MDB_DEBUG
490static int mdb_debug;
491static txnid_t mdb_debug_start;
492
496# define DPRINTF(args) ((void) ((mdb_debug) && DPRINTF0 args))
497# define DPRINTF0(fmt, ...) \
498 fprintf(stderr, "%s:%d " fmt "\n", mdb_func_, __LINE__, __VA_ARGS__)
499#else
500# define DPRINTF(args) ((void) 0)
501#endif
505#define DPUTS(arg) DPRINTF(("%s", arg))
507#define DDBI(mc) \
508 (((mc)->mc_flags & C_SUB) ? -(int)(mc)->mc_dbi : (int)(mc)->mc_dbi)
527#define MAX_PAGESIZE (PAGEBASE ? 0x10000 : 0x8000)
528
541#define MDB_MINKEYS 2
542
547#define MDB_MAGIC 0xBEEFC0DE
548
550#define MDB_DATA_VERSION ((MDB_DEVEL) ? 999 : 1)
552#define MDB_LOCK_VERSION 1
553
570#ifndef MDB_MAXKEYSIZE
571#define MDB_MAXKEYSIZE ((MDB_DEVEL) ? 0 : 511)
572#endif
573
575#if MDB_MAXKEYSIZE
576#define ENV_MAXKEY(env) (MDB_MAXKEYSIZE)
577#else
578#define ENV_MAXKEY(env) ((env)->me_maxkey)
579#endif
580
585#define MAXDATASIZE 0xffffffffUL
586
587#if MDB_DEBUG
591#define DKBUF_MAXKEYSIZE ((MDB_MAXKEYSIZE) > 0 ? (MDB_MAXKEYSIZE) : 511)
596#define DKBUF char kbuf[DKBUF_MAXKEYSIZE*2+1]
601#define DKEY(x) mdb_dkey(x, kbuf)
602#else
603#define DKBUF
604#define DKEY(x) 0
605#endif
606
610#define P_INVALID (~(pgno_t)0)
611
613#define F_ISSET(w, f) (((w) & (f)) == (f))
614
616#define EVEN(n) (((n) + 1U) & -2) /* sign-extending -2 to match n+1U */
617
622typedef uint16_t indx_t;
623
628#define DEFAULT_MAPSIZE 1048576
629
674#define DEFAULT_READERS 126
675
681#ifndef CACHELINE
682#define CACHELINE 64
683#endif
684
693typedef struct MDB_rxbody {
701 volatile txnid_t mrb_txnid;
703 volatile MDB_PID_T mrb_pid;
705 volatile MDB_THR_T mrb_tid;
706} MDB_rxbody;
707
709typedef struct MDB_reader {
710 union {
711 MDB_rxbody mrx;
713#define mr_txnid mru.mrx.mrb_txnid
714#define mr_pid mru.mrx.mrb_pid
715#define mr_tid mru.mrx.mrb_tid
717 char pad[(sizeof(MDB_rxbody)+CACHELINE-1) & ~(CACHELINE-1)];
718 } mru;
719} MDB_reader;
720
735typedef struct MDB_txbody {
738 uint32_t mtb_magic;
740 uint32_t mtb_format;
741#if defined(_WIN32) || defined(MDB_USE_POSIX_SEM)
742 char mtb_rmname[MNAME_LEN];
743#else
747 mdb_mutex_t mtb_rmutex;
748#endif
753 volatile txnid_t mtb_txnid;
758 volatile unsigned mtb_numreaders;
759} MDB_txbody;
760
762typedef struct MDB_txninfo {
763 union {
764 MDB_txbody mtb;
765#define mti_magic mt1.mtb.mtb_magic
766#define mti_format mt1.mtb.mtb_format
767#define mti_rmutex mt1.mtb.mtb_rmutex
768#define mti_rmname mt1.mtb.mtb_rmname
769#define mti_txnid mt1.mtb.mtb_txnid
770#define mti_numreaders mt1.mtb.mtb_numreaders
771 char pad[(sizeof(MDB_txbody)+CACHELINE-1) & ~(CACHELINE-1)];
772 } mt1;
773 union {
774#if defined(_WIN32) || defined(MDB_USE_POSIX_SEM)
775 char mt2_wmname[MNAME_LEN];
776#define mti_wmname mt2.mt2_wmname
777#else
778 mdb_mutex_t mt2_wmutex;
779#define mti_wmutex mt2.mt2_wmutex
780#endif
781 char pad[(MNAME_LEN+CACHELINE-1) & ~(CACHELINE-1)];
782 } mt2;
783 MDB_reader mti_readers[1];
784} MDB_txninfo;
785
787#define MDB_LOCK_FORMAT \
788 ((uint32_t) \
789 ((MDB_LOCK_VERSION) \
790 /* Flags which describe functionality */ \
791 + (((MDB_PIDLOCK) != 0) << 16)))
812typedef struct MDB_page {
813#define mp_pgno mp_p.p_pgno
814#define mp_next mp_p.p_next
815 union {
816 pgno_t p_pgno;
817 struct MDB_page *p_next;
818 } mp_p;
819 uint16_t mp_pad;
825#define P_BRANCH 0x01
826#define P_LEAF 0x02
827#define P_OVERFLOW 0x04
828#define P_META 0x08
829#define P_DIRTY 0x10
830#define P_LEAF2 0x20
831#define P_SUBP 0x40
832#define P_LOOSE 0x4000
833#define P_KEEP 0x8000
835 uint16_t mp_flags;
836#define mp_lower mp_pb.pb.pb_lower
837#define mp_upper mp_pb.pb.pb_upper
838#define mp_pages mp_pb.pb_pages
839 union {
840 struct {
841 indx_t pb_lower;
842 indx_t pb_upper;
843 } pb;
844 uint32_t pb_pages;
845 } mp_pb;
846 indx_t mp_ptrs[1];
847} MDB_page;
848
850#define PAGEHDRSZ ((unsigned) offsetof(MDB_page, mp_ptrs))
851
853#define METADATA(p) ((void *)((char *)(p) + PAGEHDRSZ))
854
856#define PAGEBASE ((MDB_DEVEL) ? PAGEHDRSZ : 0)
857
859#define NUMKEYS(p) (((p)->mp_lower - (PAGEHDRSZ-PAGEBASE)) >> 1)
860
862#define SIZELEFT(p) (indx_t)((p)->mp_upper - (p)->mp_lower)
863
865#define PAGEFILL(env, p) (1000L * ((env)->me_psize - PAGEHDRSZ - SIZELEFT(p)) / \
866 ((env)->me_psize - PAGEHDRSZ))
870#define FILL_THRESHOLD 250
871
873#define IS_LEAF(p) F_ISSET((p)->mp_flags, P_LEAF)
875#define IS_LEAF2(p) F_ISSET((p)->mp_flags, P_LEAF2)
877#define IS_BRANCH(p) F_ISSET((p)->mp_flags, P_BRANCH)
879#define IS_OVERFLOW(p) F_ISSET((p)->mp_flags, P_OVERFLOW)
881#define IS_SUBP(p) F_ISSET((p)->mp_flags, P_SUBP)
882
884#define OVPAGES(size, psize) ((PAGEHDRSZ-1 + (size)) / (psize) + 1)
885
889#define NEXT_LOOSE_PAGE(p) (*(MDB_page **)((p) + 2))
890
905typedef struct MDB_node {
908#if BYTE_ORDER == LITTLE_ENDIAN
909 unsigned short mn_lo, mn_hi;
910#else
911 unsigned short mn_hi, mn_lo;
912#endif
919#define F_BIGDATA 0x01
920#define F_SUBDATA 0x02
921#define F_DUPDATA 0x04
924#define NODE_ADD_FLAGS (F_DUPDATA|F_SUBDATA|MDB_RESERVE|MDB_APPEND)
925
927 unsigned short mn_flags;
928 unsigned short mn_ksize;
929 char mn_data[1];
930} MDB_node;
931
933#define NODESIZE offsetof(MDB_node, mn_data)
934
936#define PGNO_TOPWORD ((pgno_t)-1 > 0xffffffffu ? 32 : 0)
937
941#define INDXSIZE(k) (NODESIZE + ((k) == NULL ? 0 : (k)->mv_size))
942
946#define LEAFSIZE(k, d) (NODESIZE + (k)->mv_size + (d)->mv_size)
947
949#define NODEPTR(p, i) ((MDB_node *)((char *)(p) + (p)->mp_ptrs[i] + PAGEBASE))
950
952#define NODEKEY(node) (void *)((node)->mn_data)
953
955#define NODEDATA(node) (void *)((char *)(node)->mn_data + (node)->mn_ksize)
956
958#define NODEPGNO(node) \
959 ((node)->mn_lo | ((pgno_t) (node)->mn_hi << 16) | \
960 (PGNO_TOPWORD ? ((pgno_t) (node)->mn_flags << PGNO_TOPWORD) : 0))
962#define SETPGNO(node,pgno) do { \
963 (node)->mn_lo = (pgno) & 0xffff; (node)->mn_hi = (pgno) >> 16; \
964 if (PGNO_TOPWORD) (node)->mn_flags = (pgno) >> PGNO_TOPWORD; } while(0)
965
967#define NODEDSZ(node) ((node)->mn_lo | ((unsigned)(node)->mn_hi << 16))
969#define SETDSZ(node,size) do { \
970 (node)->mn_lo = (size) & 0xffff; (node)->mn_hi = (size) >> 16;} while(0)
972#define NODEKSZ(node) ((node)->mn_ksize)
973
975#ifdef MISALIGNED_OK
976#define COPY_PGNO(dst,src) dst = src
977#else
978#if SIZE_MAX > 4294967295UL
979#define COPY_PGNO(dst,src) do { \
980 unsigned short *s, *d; \
981 s = (unsigned short *)&(src); \
982 d = (unsigned short *)&(dst); \
983 *d++ = *s++; \
984 *d++ = *s++; \
985 *d++ = *s++; \
986 *d = *s; \
987} while (0)
988#else
989#define COPY_PGNO(dst,src) do { \
990 unsigned short *s, *d; \
991 s = (unsigned short *)&(src); \
992 d = (unsigned short *)&(dst); \
993 *d++ = *s++; \
994 *d = *s; \
995} while (0)
996#endif
997#endif
1002#define LEAF2KEY(p, i, ks) ((char *)(p) + PAGEHDRSZ + ((i)*(ks)))
1003
1005#define MDB_GET_KEY(node, keyptr) { if ((keyptr) != NULL) { \
1006 (keyptr)->mv_size = NODEKSZ(node); (keyptr)->mv_data = NODEKEY(node); } }
1007
1009#define MDB_GET_KEY2(node, key) { key.mv_size = NODEKSZ(node); key.mv_data = NODEKEY(node); }
1010
1012typedef struct MDB_db {
1013 uint32_t md_pad;
1014 uint16_t md_flags;
1015 uint16_t md_depth;
1016 pgno_t md_branch_pages;
1017 pgno_t md_leaf_pages;
1018 pgno_t md_overflow_pages;
1019 size_t md_entries;
1020 pgno_t md_root;
1021} MDB_db;
1022
1023#define MDB_VALID 0x8000
1024#define PERSISTENT_FLAGS (0xffff & ~(MDB_VALID))
1026#define VALID_FLAGS (MDB_REVERSEKEY|MDB_DUPSORT|MDB_INTEGERKEY|MDB_DUPFIXED|\
1027 MDB_INTEGERDUP|MDB_REVERSEDUP|MDB_CREATE)
1028
1030#define FREE_DBI 0
1032#define MAIN_DBI 1
1034#define CORE_DBS 2
1035
1037#define NUM_METAS 2
1038
1043typedef struct MDB_meta {
1046 uint32_t mm_magic;
1048 uint32_t mm_version;
1049 void *mm_address;
1050 size_t mm_mapsize;
1051 MDB_db mm_dbs[CORE_DBS];
1053#define mm_psize mm_dbs[FREE_DBI].md_pad
1055#define mm_flags mm_dbs[FREE_DBI].md_flags
1059 pgno_t mm_last_pg;
1060 volatile txnid_t mm_txnid;
1061} MDB_meta;
1062
1068typedef union MDB_metabuf {
1069 MDB_page mb_page;
1070 struct {
1071 char mm_pad[PAGEHDRSZ];
1072 MDB_meta mm_meta;
1073 } mb_metabuf;
1074} MDB_metabuf;
1075
1080typedef struct MDB_dbx {
1081 MDB_val md_name;
1082 MDB_cmp_func *md_cmp;
1083 MDB_cmp_func *md_dcmp;
1084 MDB_rel_func *md_rel;
1085 void *md_relctx;
1086} MDB_dbx;
1087
1091struct MDB_txn {
1092 MDB_txn *mt_parent;
1094 MDB_txn *mt_child;
1095 pgno_t mt_next_pgno;
1100 txnid_t mt_txnid;
1101 MDB_env *mt_env;
1104 MDB_IDL mt_free_pgs;
1108 MDB_page *mt_loose_pgs;
1110 int mt_loose_count;
1115 MDB_IDL mt_spill_pgs;
1116 union {
1118 MDB_ID2L dirty_list;
1120 MDB_reader *reader;
1121 } mt_u;
1123 MDB_dbx *mt_dbxs;
1125 MDB_db *mt_dbs;
1127 unsigned int *mt_dbiseqs;
1132#define DB_DIRTY 0x01
1133#define DB_STALE 0x02
1134#define DB_NEW 0x04
1135#define DB_VALID 0x08
1136#define DB_USRVALID 0x10
1137#define DB_DUPDATA 0x20
1140 MDB_cursor **mt_cursors;
1142 unsigned char *mt_dbflags;
1147 MDB_dbi mt_numdbs;
1148
1154#define MDB_TXN_BEGIN_FLAGS MDB_RDONLY
1155#define MDB_TXN_RDONLY MDB_RDONLY
1156 /* internal txn flags */
1157#define MDB_TXN_WRITEMAP MDB_WRITEMAP
1158#define MDB_TXN_FINISHED 0x01
1159#define MDB_TXN_ERROR 0x02
1160#define MDB_TXN_DIRTY 0x04
1161#define MDB_TXN_SPILLS 0x08
1162#define MDB_TXN_HAS_CHILD 0x10
1164#define MDB_TXN_BLOCKED (MDB_TXN_FINISHED|MDB_TXN_ERROR|MDB_TXN_HAS_CHILD)
1166 unsigned int mt_flags;
1172 unsigned int mt_dirty_room;
1173};
1174
1179#define CURSOR_STACK 32
1180
1181struct MDB_xcursor;
1182
1191struct MDB_cursor {
1193 MDB_cursor *mc_next;
1195 MDB_cursor *mc_backup;
1197 struct MDB_xcursor *mc_xcursor;
1199 MDB_txn *mc_txn;
1201 MDB_dbi mc_dbi;
1203 MDB_db *mc_db;
1205 MDB_dbx *mc_dbx;
1207 unsigned char *mc_dbflag;
1208 unsigned short mc_snum;
1209 unsigned short mc_top;
1215#define C_INITIALIZED 0x01
1216#define C_EOF 0x02
1217#define C_SUB 0x04
1218#define C_DEL 0x08
1219#define C_UNTRACK 0x40
1221 unsigned int mc_flags;
1222 MDB_page *mc_pg[CURSOR_STACK];
1223 indx_t mc_ki[CURSOR_STACK];
1224};
1225
1231typedef struct MDB_xcursor {
1233 MDB_cursor mx_cursor;
1235 MDB_db mx_db;
1237 MDB_dbx mx_dbx;
1239 unsigned char mx_dbflag;
1240} MDB_xcursor;
1241
1243#define XCURSOR_INITED(mc) \
1244 ((mc)->mc_xcursor && ((mc)->mc_xcursor->mx_cursor.mc_flags & C_INITIALIZED))
1245
1250#define XCURSOR_REFRESH(mc, top, mp) do { \
1251 MDB_page *xr_pg = (mp); \
1252 MDB_node *xr_node; \
1253 if (!XCURSOR_INITED(mc) || (mc)->mc_ki[top] >= NUMKEYS(xr_pg)) break; \
1254 xr_node = NODEPTR(xr_pg, (mc)->mc_ki[top]); \
1255 if ((xr_node->mn_flags & (F_DUPDATA|F_SUBDATA)) == F_DUPDATA) \
1256 (mc)->mc_xcursor->mx_cursor.mc_pg[0] = NODEDATA(xr_node); \
1257} while (0)
1258
1260typedef struct MDB_pgstate {
1261 pgno_t *mf_pghead;
1262 txnid_t mf_pglast;
1263} MDB_pgstate;
1264
1266struct MDB_env {
1267 HANDLE me_fd;
1268 HANDLE me_lfd;
1269 HANDLE me_mfd;
1271#define MDB_FATAL_ERROR 0x80000000U
1273#define MDB_ENV_ACTIVE 0x20000000U
1275#define MDB_ENV_TXKEY 0x10000000U
1277#define MDB_FSYNCONLY 0x08000000U
1278 uint32_t me_flags;
1279 unsigned int me_psize;
1280 unsigned int me_os_psize;
1281 unsigned int me_maxreaders;
1283 volatile int me_close_readers;
1284 MDB_dbi me_numdbs;
1285 MDB_dbi me_maxdbs;
1286 MDB_PID_T me_pid;
1287 char *me_path;
1288 char *me_map;
1289 MDB_txninfo *me_txns;
1290 MDB_meta *me_metas[NUM_METAS];
1291 void *me_pbuf;
1292 MDB_txn *me_txn;
1293 MDB_txn *me_txn0;
1294 size_t me_mapsize;
1295 off_t me_size;
1296 pgno_t me_maxpg;
1297 MDB_dbx *me_dbxs;
1298 uint16_t *me_dbflags;
1299 unsigned int *me_dbiseqs;
1300 pthread_key_t me_txkey;
1301 txnid_t me_pgoldest;
1302 MDB_pgstate me_pgstate;
1303# define me_pglast me_pgstate.mf_pglast
1304# define me_pghead me_pgstate.mf_pghead
1305 MDB_page *me_dpages;
1307 MDB_IDL me_free_pgs;
1309 MDB_ID2L me_dirty_list;
1311 int me_maxfree_1pg;
1313 unsigned int me_nodemax;
1314#if !(MDB_MAXKEYSIZE)
1315 unsigned int me_maxkey;
1316#endif
1317 int me_live_reader;
1318#ifdef _WIN32
1319 int me_pidquery;
1320#endif
1321#ifdef MDB_USE_POSIX_MUTEX /* Posix mutexes reside in shared mem */
1322# define me_rmutex me_txns->mti_rmutex
1323# define me_wmutex me_txns->mti_wmutex
1324#else
1325 mdb_mutex_t me_rmutex;
1326 mdb_mutex_t me_wmutex;
1327#endif
1328 void *me_userctx;
1329 MDB_assert_func *me_assert_func;
1330};
1331
1333typedef struct MDB_ntxn {
1334 MDB_txn mnt_txn;
1335 MDB_pgstate mnt_pgstate;
1336} MDB_ntxn;

1339#define MDB_COMMIT_PAGES 64
1340#if defined(IOV_MAX) && IOV_MAX < MDB_COMMIT_PAGES
1341#undef MDB_COMMIT_PAGES
1342#define MDB_COMMIT_PAGES IOV_MAX
1343#endif
1344
1346#define MAX_WRITE (0x40000000U >> (sizeof(ssize_t) == 4))
1347
1349#define TXN_DBI_EXIST(txn, dbi, validity) \
1350 ((txn) && (dbi)<(txn)->mt_numdbs && ((txn)->mt_dbflags[dbi] & (validity)))
1351
1353#define TXN_DBI_CHANGED(txn, dbi) \
1354 ((txn)->mt_dbiseqs[dbi] != (txn)->mt_env->me_dbiseqs[dbi])

1356static int mdb_page_alloc(MDB_cursor *mc, int num, MDB_page **mp);
1357static int mdb_page_new(MDB_cursor *mc, uint32_t flags, int num, MDB_page **mp);
1358static int mdb_page_touch(MDB_cursor *mc);
1359
1360#define MDB_END_NAMES {"committed", "empty-commit", "abort", "reset", \
1361 "reset-tmp", "fail-begin", "fail-beginchild"}
1362enum {
1363 /* mdb_txn_end operation number, for logging */
1364 MDB_END_COMMITTED, MDB_END_EMPTY_COMMIT, MDB_END_ABORT, MDB_END_RESET,
1365 MDB_END_RESET_TMP, MDB_END_FAIL_BEGIN, MDB_END_FAIL_BEGINCHILD
1366};
1367#define MDB_END_OPMASK 0x0F
1368#define MDB_END_UPDATE 0x10
1369#define MDB_END_FREE 0x20
1370#define MDB_END_SLOT MDB_NOTLS
1371static void mdb_txn_end(MDB_txn *txn, unsigned mode);

1386 pgno_t newpgno, unsigned int nflags);

1418 int *exactp);

1450
1452char * ESECT
1453mdb_version(int *major, int *minor, int *patch)
1454{
1455 if (major) *major = MDB_VERSION_MAJOR;
1456 if (minor) *minor = MDB_VERSION_MINOR;
1457 if (patch) *patch = MDB_VERSION_PATCH;
1458 return MDB_VERSION_STRING;
1459}
1460
1462static char *const mdb_errstr[] = {
1463 "MDB_KEYEXIST: Key/data pair already exists",
1464 "MDB_NOTFOUND: No matching key/data pair found",
1465 "MDB_PAGE_NOTFOUND: Requested page not found",
1466 "MDB_CORRUPTED: Located page was wrong type",
1467 "MDB_PANIC: Update of meta page failed or environment had fatal error",
1468 "MDB_VERSION_MISMATCH: Database environment version mismatch",
1469 "MDB_INVALID: File is not an LMDB file",
1470 "MDB_MAP_FULL: Environment mapsize limit reached",
1471 "MDB_DBS_FULL: Environment maxdbs limit reached",
1472 "MDB_READERS_FULL: Environment maxreaders limit reached",
1473 "MDB_TLS_FULL: Thread-local storage keys full - too many environments open",
1474 "MDB_TXN_FULL: Transaction has too many dirty pages - transaction too big",
1475 "MDB_CURSOR_FULL: Internal error - cursor stack limit reached",
1476 "MDB_PAGE_FULL: Internal error - page has no more space",
1477 "MDB_MAP_RESIZED: Database contents grew beyond environment mapsize",
1478 "MDB_INCOMPATIBLE: Operation and DB incompatible, or DB flags changed",
1479 "MDB_BAD_RSLOT: Invalid reuse of reader locktable slot",
1480 "MDB_BAD_TXN: Transaction must abort, has a child, or is invalid",
1481 "MDB_BAD_VALSIZE: Unsupported size of key/DB name/data, or wrong DUPFIXED size",
1482 "MDB_BAD_DBI: The specified DBI handle was closed/changed unexpectedly",
1483};
1484
1485char *
1486mdb_strerror(int err)
1487{
1488#ifdef _WIN32
1493#define MSGSIZE 1024
1494#define PADSIZE 4096
1495 char buf[MSGSIZE+PADSIZE], *ptr = buf;
1496#endif
1497 int i;
1498 if (!err)
1499 return ("Successful return: 0");
1500
1501 if (err >= MDB_KEYEXIST && err <= MDB_LAST_ERRCODE) {
1502 i = err - MDB_KEYEXIST;
1503 return mdb_errstr[i];
1504 }
1505
1506#ifdef _WIN32
1507 /* These are the C-runtime error codes we use. The comment indicates
1508 * their numeric value, and the Win32 error they would correspond to
1509 * if the error actually came from a Win32 API. A major mess, we should
1510 * have used LMDB-specific error codes for everything.
1511 */
1512 switch(err) {
1513 case ENOENT: /* 2, FILE_NOT_FOUND */
1514 case EIO: /* 5, ACCESS_DENIED */
1515 case ENOMEM: /* 12, INVALID_ACCESS */
1516 case EACCES: /* 13, INVALID_DATA */
1517 case EBUSY: /* 16, CURRENT_DIRECTORY */
1518 case EINVAL: /* 22, BAD_COMMAND */
1519 case ENOSPC: /* 28, OUT_OF_PAPER */
1520 return strerror(err);
1521 default:
1522 ;
1523 }
1524 buf[0] = 0;
1525 FormatMessageA(FORMAT_MESSAGE_FROM_SYSTEM |
1526 FORMAT_MESSAGE_IGNORE_INSERTS,
1527 NULL, err, 0, ptr, MSGSIZE, (va_list *)buf+MSGSIZE);
1528 return ptr;
1529#else
1530 return strerror(err);
1531#endif
1532}
1533
1535#define mdb_cassert(mc, expr) mdb_assert0((mc)->mc_txn->mt_env, expr, #expr)
1537#define mdb_tassert(txn, expr) mdb_assert0((txn)->mt_env, expr, #expr)
1539#define mdb_eassert(env, expr) mdb_assert0(env, expr, #expr)
1540
1541#ifndef NDEBUG
1542# define mdb_assert0(env, expr, expr_txt) ((expr) ? (void)0 : \
1543 mdb_assert_fail(env, expr_txt, mdb_func_, __FILE__, __LINE__))
1544
1545static void ESECT
1546mdb_assert_fail(MDB_env *env, const char *expr_txt,
1547 const char *func, const char *file, int line)
1548{
1549 char buf[400];
1550 sprintf(buf, "%.100s:%d: Assertion '%.200s' failed in %.40s()",
1551 file, line, expr_txt, func);
1552 if (env->me_assert_func)
1553 env->me_assert_func(env, buf);
1554 fprintf(stderr, "%s\n", buf);
1555 abort();
1556}
1557#else
1558# define mdb_assert0(env, expr, expr_txt) ((void) 0)
1559#endif /* NDEBUG */
1560
1561#if MDB_DEBUG
1563static pgno_t
1564mdb_dbg_pgno(MDB_page *mp)
1565{
1566 pgno_t ret;
1567 COPY_PGNO(ret, mp->mp_pgno);
1568 return ret;
1569}
1570
1576char *
1577mdb_dkey(MDB_val *key, char *buf)
1578{
1579 char *ptr = buf;
1580 unsigned char *c = key->mv_data;
1581 unsigned int i;
1582
1583 if (!key)
1584 return "";
1585
1586 if (key->mv_size > DKBUF_MAXKEYSIZE)
1587 return "MDB_MAXKEYSIZE";
1588 /* may want to make this a dynamic check: if the key is mostly
1589 * printable characters, print it as-is instead of converting to hex.
1590 */
1591#if 1
1592 buf[0] = '\0';
1593 for (i=0; i<key->mv_size; i++)
1594 ptr += sprintf(ptr, "%02x", *c++);
1595#else
1596 sprintf(buf, "%.*s", key->mv_size, key->mv_data);
1597#endif
1598 return buf;
1599}
1600
1601static const char *
1602mdb_leafnode_type(MDB_node *n)
1603{
1604 static char *const tp[2][2] = {{"", ": DB"}, {": sub-page", ": sub-DB"}};
1605 return F_ISSET(n->mn_flags, F_BIGDATA) ? ": overflow page" :
1606 tp[F_ISSET(n->mn_flags, F_DUPDATA)][F_ISSET(n->mn_flags, F_SUBDATA)];
1607}
1608
1610void
1611mdb_page_list(MDB_page *mp)
1612{
1613 pgno_t pgno = mdb_dbg_pgno(mp);
1614 const char *type, *state = (mp->mp_flags & P_DIRTY) ? ", dirty" : "";
1615 MDB_node *node;
1616 unsigned int i, nkeys, nsize, total = 0;
1617 MDB_val key;
1618 DKBUF;
1619
1620 switch (mp->mp_flags & (P_BRANCH|P_LEAF|P_LEAF2|P_META|P_OVERFLOW|P_SUBP)) {
1621 case P_BRANCH: type = "Branch page"; break;
1622 case P_LEAF: type = "Leaf page"; break;
1623 case P_LEAF|P_SUBP: type = "Sub-page"; break;
1624 case P_LEAF|P_LEAF2: type = "LEAF2 page"; break;
1625 case P_LEAF|P_LEAF2|P_SUBP: type = "LEAF2 sub-page"; break;
1626 case P_OVERFLOW:
1627 fprintf(stderr, "Overflow page %"Z"u pages %u%s\n",
1628 pgno, mp->mp_pages, state);
1629 return;
1630 case P_META:
1631 fprintf(stderr, "Meta-page %"Z"u txnid %"Z"u\n",
1632 pgno, ((MDB_meta *)METADATA(mp))->mm_txnid);
1633 return;
1634 default:
1635 fprintf(stderr, "Bad page %"Z"u flags 0x%X\n", pgno, mp->mp_flags);
1636 return;
1637 }
1638
1639 nkeys = NUMKEYS(mp);
1640 fprintf(stderr, "%s %"Z"u numkeys %d%s\n", type, pgno, nkeys, state);
1641
1642 for (i=0; i<nkeys; i++) {
1643 if (IS_LEAF2(mp)) { /* LEAF2 pages have no mp_ptrs[] or node headers */
1644 key.mv_size = nsize = mp->mp_pad;
1645 key.mv_data = LEAF2KEY(mp, i, nsize);
1646 total += nsize;
1647 fprintf(stderr, "key %d: nsize %d, %s\n", i, nsize, DKEY(&key));
1648 continue;
1649 }
1650 node = NODEPTR(mp, i);
1651 key.mv_size = node->mn_ksize;
1652 key.mv_data = node->mn_data;
1653 nsize = NODESIZE + key.mv_size;
1654 if (IS_BRANCH(mp)) {
1655 fprintf(stderr, "key %d: page %"Z"u, %s\n", i, NODEPGNO(node),
1656 DKEY(&key));
1657 total += nsize;
1658 } else {
1659 if (F_ISSET(node->mn_flags, F_BIGDATA))
1660 nsize += sizeof(pgno_t);
1661 else
1662 nsize += NODEDSZ(node);
1663 total += nsize;
1664 nsize += sizeof(indx_t);
1665 fprintf(stderr, "key %d: nsize %d, %s%s\n",
1666 i, nsize, DKEY(&key), mdb_leafnode_type(node));
1667 }
1668 total = EVEN(total);
1669 }
1670 fprintf(stderr, "Total: header %d + contents %d + unused %d\n",
1671 IS_LEAF2(mp) ? PAGEHDRSZ : PAGEBASE + mp->mp_lower, total, SIZELEFT(mp));
1672}
1673
1674void
1675mdb_cursor_chk(MDB_cursor *mc)
1676{
1677 unsigned int i;
1678 MDB_node *node;
1679 MDB_page *mp;
1680
1681 if (!mc->mc_snum || !(mc->mc_flags & C_INITIALIZED)) return;
1682 for (i=0; i<mc->mc_top; i++) {
1683 mp = mc->mc_pg[i];
1684 node = NODEPTR(mp, mc->mc_ki[i]);
1685 if (NODEPGNO(node) != mc->mc_pg[i+1]->mp_pgno)
1686 printf("oops!\n");
1687 }
1688 if (mc->mc_ki[i] >= NUMKEYS(mc->mc_pg[i]))
1689 printf("ack!\n");
1690 if (XCURSOR_INITED(mc)) {
1691 node = NODEPTR(mc->mc_pg[mc->mc_top], mc->mc_ki[mc->mc_top]);
1692 if (((node->mn_flags & (F_DUPDATA|F_SUBDATA)) == F_DUPDATA) &&
1693 mc->mc_xcursor->mx_cursor.mc_pg[0] != NODEDATA(node)) {
1694 printf("blah!\n");
1695 }
1696 }
1697}
1698#endif
1699
1700#if (MDB_DEBUG) > 2
1706static void mdb_audit(MDB_txn *txn)
1707{
1708 MDB_cursor mc;
1709 MDB_val key, data;
1710 MDB_ID freecount, count;
1711 MDB_dbi i;
1712 int rc;
1713
1714 freecount = 0;
1715 mdb_cursor_init(&mc, txn, FREE_DBI, NULL);
1716 while ((rc = mdb_cursor_get(&mc, &key, &data, MDB_NEXT)) == 0)
1717 freecount += *(MDB_ID *)data.mv_data;
1718 mdb_tassert(txn, rc == MDB_NOTFOUND);
1719
1720 count = 0;
1721 for (i = 0; i<txn->mt_numdbs; i++) {
1722 MDB_xcursor mx;
1723 if (!(txn->mt_dbflags[i] & DB_VALID))
1724 continue;
1725 mdb_cursor_init(&mc, txn, i, &mx);
1726 if (txn->mt_dbs[i].md_root == P_INVALID)
1727 continue;
1728 count += txn->mt_dbs[i].md_branch_pages +
1729 txn->mt_dbs[i].md_leaf_pages +
1730 txn->mt_dbs[i].md_overflow_pages;
1731 if (txn->mt_dbs[i].md_flags & MDB_DUPSORT) {
1732 rc = mdb_page_search(&mc, NULL, MDB_PS_FIRST);
1733 for (; rc == MDB_SUCCESS; rc = mdb_cursor_sibling(&mc, 1)) {
1734 unsigned j;
1735 MDB_page *mp;
1736 mp = mc.mc_pg[mc.mc_top];
1737 for (j=0; j<NUMKEYS(mp); j++) {
1738 MDB_node *leaf = NODEPTR(mp, j);
1739 if (leaf->mn_flags & F_SUBDATA) {
1740 MDB_db db;
1741 memcpy(&db, NODEDATA(leaf), sizeof(db));
1742 count += db.md_branch_pages + db.md_leaf_pages +
1743 db.md_overflow_pages;
1744 }
1745 }
1746 }
1747 mdb_tassert(txn, rc == MDB_NOTFOUND);
1748 }
1749 }
1750 if (freecount + count + NUM_METAS != txn->mt_next_pgno) {
1751 fprintf(stderr, "audit: %"Z"u freecount: %"Z"u count: %"Z"u total: %"Z"u next_pgno: %"Z"u\n",
1752 txn->mt_txnid, freecount, count+NUM_METAS,
1753 freecount+count+NUM_METAS, txn->mt_next_pgno);
1754 }
1755}
1756#endif
1757
1758int
1759mdb_cmp(MDB_txn *txn, MDB_dbi dbi, const MDB_val *a, const MDB_val *b)
1760{
1761 return txn->mt_dbxs[dbi].md_cmp(a, b);
1762}
1763
1764int
1765mdb_dcmp(MDB_txn *txn, MDB_dbi dbi, const MDB_val *a, const MDB_val *b)
1766{
1767 MDB_cmp_func *dcmp = txn->mt_dbxs[dbi].md_dcmp;
1768#if UINT_MAX < SIZE_MAX
1769 if (dcmp == mdb_cmp_int && a->mv_size == sizeof(size_t))
1770 dcmp = mdb_cmp_clong;
1771#endif
1772 return dcmp(a, b);
1773}
1774
1779static MDB_page *
1780mdb_page_malloc(MDB_txn *txn, unsigned num)
1781{
1782 MDB_env *env = txn->mt_env;
1783 MDB_page *ret = env->me_dpages;
1784 size_t psize = env->me_psize, sz = psize, off;
1785 /* For ! #MDB_NOMEMINIT, psize counts how much to init.
1786 * For a single page alloc, we init everything after the page header.
1787 * For multi-page, we init the final page; if the caller needed that
1788 * many pages they will be filling in at least up to the last page.
1789 */
1790 if (num == 1) {
1791 if (ret) {
1792 VGMEMP_ALLOC(env, ret, sz);
1793 VGMEMP_DEFINED(ret, sizeof(ret->mp_next));
1794 env->me_dpages = ret->mp_next;
1795 return ret;
1796 }
1797 psize -= off = PAGEHDRSZ;
1798 } else {
1799 sz *= num;
1800 off = sz - psize;
1801 }
1802 if ((ret = malloc(sz)) != NULL) {
1803 VGMEMP_ALLOC(env, ret, sz);
1804 if (!(env->me_flags & MDB_NOMEMINIT)) {
1805 memset((char *)ret + off, 0, psize);
1806 ret->mp_pad = 0;
1807 }
1808 } else {
1809 txn->mt_flags |= MDB_TXN_ERROR;
1810 }
1811 return ret;
1812}
1817static void
1818mdb_page_free(MDB_env *env, MDB_page *mp)
1819{
1820 mp->mp_next = env->me_dpages;
1821 VGMEMP_FREE(env, mp);
1822 env->me_dpages = mp;
1823}
1824
1826static void
1827mdb_dpage_free(MDB_env *env, MDB_page *dp)
1828{
1829 if (!IS_OVERFLOW(dp) || dp->mp_pages == 1) {
1830 mdb_page_free(env, dp);
1831 } else {
1832 /* large pages just get freed directly */
1833 VGMEMP_FREE(env, dp);
1834 free(dp);
1835 }
1836}
1837
1839static void
1840mdb_dlist_free(MDB_txn *txn)
1841{
1842 MDB_env *env = txn->mt_env;
1843 MDB_ID2L dl = txn->mt_u.dirty_list;
1844 unsigned i, n = dl[0].mid;
1845
1846 for (i = 1; i <= n; i++) {
1847 mdb_dpage_free(env, dl[i].mptr);
1848 }
1849 dl[0].mid = 0;
1850}
1851
1862static int
1863mdb_page_loose(MDB_cursor *mc, MDB_page *mp)
1864{
1865 int loose = 0;
1866 pgno_t pgno = mp->mp_pgno;
1867 MDB_txn *txn = mc->mc_txn;
1868
1869 if ((mp->mp_flags & P_DIRTY) && mc->mc_dbi != FREE_DBI) {
1870 if (txn->mt_parent) {
1871 MDB_ID2 *dl = txn->mt_u.dirty_list;
1872 /* If txn has a parent, make sure the page is in our
1873 * dirty list.
1874 */
1875 if (dl[0].mid) {
1876 unsigned x = mdb_mid2l_search(dl, pgno);
1877 if (x <= dl[0].mid && dl[x].mid == pgno) {
1878 if (mp != dl[x].mptr) { /* bad cursor? */
1879 mc->mc_flags &= ~(C_INITIALIZED|C_EOF);
1880 txn->mt_flags |= MDB_TXN_ERROR;
1881 return MDB_CORRUPTED;
1882 }
1883 /* ok, it's ours */
1884 loose = 1;
1885 }
1886 }
1887 } else {
1888 /* no parent txn, so it's just ours */
1889 loose = 1;
1890 }
1891 }
1892 if (loose) {
1893 DPRINTF(("loosen db %d page %"Z"u", DDBI(mc),
1894 mp->mp_pgno));
1895 NEXT_LOOSE_PAGE(mp) = txn->mt_loose_pgs;
1896 txn->mt_loose_pgs = mp;
1897 txn->mt_loose_count++;
1898 mp->mp_flags |= P_LOOSE;
1899 } else {
1900 int rc = mdb_midl_append(&txn->mt_free_pgs, pgno);
1901 if (rc)
1902 return rc;
1903 }
1904
1905 return MDB_SUCCESS;
1906}
1907
1915static int
1916mdb_pages_xkeep(MDB_cursor *mc, unsigned pflags, int all)
1917{
1918 enum { Mask = P_SUBP|P_DIRTY|P_LOOSE|P_KEEP };
1919 MDB_txn *txn = mc->mc_txn;
1920 MDB_cursor *m3, *m0 = mc;
1921 MDB_xcursor *mx;
1922 MDB_page *dp, *mp;
1923 MDB_node *leaf;
1924 unsigned i, j;
1925 int rc = MDB_SUCCESS, level;
1926
1927 /* Mark pages seen by cursors */
1928 if (mc->mc_flags & C_UNTRACK)
1929 mc = NULL; /* will find mc in mt_cursors */
1930 for (i = txn->mt_numdbs;; mc = txn->mt_cursors[--i]) {
1931 for (; mc; mc=mc->mc_next) {
1932 if (!(mc->mc_flags & C_INITIALIZED))
1933 continue;
1934 for (m3 = mc;; m3 = &mx->mx_cursor) {
1935 mp = NULL;
1936 for (j=0; j<m3->mc_snum; j++) {
1937 mp = m3->mc_pg[j];
1938 if ((mp->mp_flags & Mask) == pflags)
1939 mp->mp_flags ^= P_KEEP;
1940 }
1941 mx = m3->mc_xcursor;
1942 /* Proceed to mx if it is at a sub-database */
1943 if (! (mx && (mx->mx_cursor.mc_flags & C_INITIALIZED)))
1944 break;
1945 if (! (mp && (mp->mp_flags & P_LEAF)))
1946 break;
1947 leaf = NODEPTR(mp, m3->mc_ki[j-1]);
1948 if (!(leaf->mn_flags & F_SUBDATA))
1949 break;
1950 }
1951 }
1952 if (i == 0)
1953 break;
1954 }
1955
1956 if (all) {
1957 /* Mark dirty root pages */
1958 for (i=0; i<txn->mt_numdbs; i++) {
1959 if (txn->mt_dbflags[i] & DB_DIRTY) {
1960 pgno_t pgno = txn->mt_dbs[i].md_root;
1961 if (pgno == P_INVALID)
1962 continue;
1963 if ((rc = mdb_page_get(m0, pgno, &dp, &level)) != MDB_SUCCESS)
1964 break;
1965 if ((dp->mp_flags & Mask) == pflags && level <= 1)
1966 dp->mp_flags ^= P_KEEP;
1967 }
1968 }
1969 }
1970
1971 return rc;
1972}
1973
1974static int mdb_page_flush(MDB_txn *txn, int keep);
1975
2008static int
2009mdb_page_spill(MDB_cursor *m0, MDB_val *key, MDB_val *data)
2010{
2011 MDB_txn *txn = m0->mc_txn;
2012 MDB_page *dp;
2013 MDB_ID2L dl = txn->mt_u.dirty_list;
2014 unsigned int i, j, need;
2015 int rc;
2016
2017 if (m0->mc_flags & C_SUB)
2018 return MDB_SUCCESS;
2019
2020 /* Estimate how much space this op will take */
2021 i = m0->mc_db->md_depth;
2022 /* Named DBs also dirty the main DB */
2023 if (m0->mc_dbi >= CORE_DBS)
2024 i += txn->mt_dbs[MAIN_DBI].md_depth;
2025 /* For puts, roughly factor in the key+data size */
2026 if (key)
2027 i += (LEAFSIZE(key, data) + txn->mt_env->me_psize) / txn->mt_env->me_psize;
2028 i += i; /* double it for good measure */
2029 need = i;
2030
2031 if (txn->mt_dirty_room > i)
2032 return MDB_SUCCESS;
2033
2034 if (!txn->mt_spill_pgs) {
2035 txn->mt_spill_pgs = mdb_midl_alloc(MDB_IDL_UM_MAX);
2036 if (!txn->mt_spill_pgs)
2037 return ENOMEM;
2038 } else {
2039 /* purge deleted slots */
2040 MDB_IDL sl = txn->mt_spill_pgs;
2041 unsigned int num = sl[0];
2042 j=0;
2043 for (i=1; i<=num; i++) {
2044 if (!(sl[i] & 1))
2045 sl[++j] = sl[i];
2046 }
2047 sl[0] = j;
2048 }
2049
2050 /* Preserve pages which may soon be dirtied again */
2051 if ((rc = mdb_pages_xkeep(m0, P_DIRTY, 1)) != MDB_SUCCESS)
2052 goto done;
2053
2054 /* Less aggressive spill - we originally spilled the entire dirty list,
2055 * with a few exceptions for cursor pages and DB root pages. But this
2056 * turns out to be a lot of wasted effort because in a large txn many
2057 * of those pages will need to be used again. So now we spill only 1/8th
2058 * of the dirty pages. Testing revealed this to be a good tradeoff,
2059 * better than 1/2, 1/4, or 1/10.
2060 */
2061 if (need < MDB_IDL_UM_MAX / 8)
2062 need = MDB_IDL_UM_MAX / 8;
2063
2064 /* Save the page IDs of all the pages we're flushing */
2065 /* flush from the tail forward, this saves a lot of shifting later on. */
2066 for (i=dl[0].mid; i && need; i--) {
2067 MDB_ID pn = dl[i].mid << 1;
2068 dp = dl[i].mptr;
2069 if (dp->mp_flags & (P_LOOSE|P_KEEP))
2070 continue;
2071 /* Can't spill twice, make sure it's not already in a parent's
2072 * spill list.
2073 */
2074 if (txn->mt_parent) {
2075 MDB_txn *tx2;
2076 for (tx2 = txn->mt_parent; tx2; tx2 = tx2->mt_parent) {
2077 if (tx2->mt_spill_pgs) {
2078 j = mdb_midl_search(tx2->mt_spill_pgs, pn);
2079 if (j <= tx2->mt_spill_pgs[0] && tx2->mt_spill_pgs[j] == pn) {
2080 dp->mp_flags |= P_KEEP;
2081 break;
2082 }
2083 }
2084 }
2085 if (tx2)
2086 continue;
2087 }
2088 if ((rc = mdb_midl_append(&txn->mt_spill_pgs, pn)))
2089 goto done;
2090 need--;
2091 }
2092 mdb_midl_sort(txn->mt_spill_pgs);
2093
2094 /* Flush the spilled part of dirty list */
2095 if ((rc = mdb_page_flush(txn, i)) != MDB_SUCCESS)
2096 goto done;
2097
2098 /* Reset any dirty pages we kept that page_flush didn't see */
2099 rc = mdb_pages_xkeep(m0, P_DIRTY|P_KEEP, i);
2100
2101done:
2102 txn->mt_flags |= rc ? MDB_TXN_ERROR : MDB_TXN_SPILLS;
2103 return rc;
2104}
2105
2107static txnid_t
2108mdb_find_oldest(MDB_txn *txn)
2109{
2110 int i;
2111 txnid_t mr, oldest = txn->mt_txnid - 1;
2112 if (txn->mt_env->me_txns) {
2113 MDB_reader *r = txn->mt_env->me_txns->mti_readers;
2114 for (i = txn->mt_env->me_txns->mti_numreaders; --i >= 0; ) {
2115 if (r[i].mr_pid) {
2116 mr = r[i].mr_txnid;
2117 if (oldest > mr)
2118 oldest = mr;
2119 }
2120 }
2121 }
2122 return oldest;
2123}
2124
2126static void
2127mdb_page_dirty(MDB_txn *txn, MDB_page *mp)
2128{
2129 MDB_ID2 mid;
2130 int rc, (*insert)(MDB_ID2L, MDB_ID2 *);
2131
2132 if (txn->mt_flags & MDB_TXN_WRITEMAP) {
2133 insert = mdb_mid2l_append;
2134 } else {
2135 insert = mdb_mid2l_insert;
2136 }
2137 mid.mid = mp->mp_pgno;
2138 mid.mptr = mp;
2139 rc = insert(txn->mt_u.dirty_list, &mid);
2140 mdb_tassert(txn, rc == 0);
2141 txn->mt_dirty_room--;
2142}
2143
2159static int
2160mdb_page_alloc(MDB_cursor *mc, int num, MDB_page **mp)
2161{
2162#ifdef MDB_PARANOID /* Seems like we can ignore this now */
2163 /* Get at most <Max_retries> more freeDB records once me_pghead
2164 * has enough pages. If not enough, use new pages from the map.
2165 * If <Paranoid> and mc is updating the freeDB, only get new
2166 * records if me_pghead is empty. Then the freelist cannot play
2167 * catch-up with itself by growing while trying to save it.
2168 */
2169 enum { Paranoid = 1, Max_retries = 500 };
2170#else
2171 enum { Paranoid = 0, Max_retries = INT_MAX /*infinite*/ };
2172#endif
2173 int rc, retry = num * 60;
2174 MDB_txn *txn = mc->mc_txn;
2175 MDB_env *env = txn->mt_env;
2176 pgno_t pgno, *mop = env->me_pghead;
2177 unsigned i, j, mop_len = mop ? mop[0] : 0, n2 = num-1;
2178 MDB_page *np;
2179 txnid_t oldest = 0, last;
2180 MDB_cursor_op op;
2181 MDB_cursor m2;
2182 int found_old = 0;
2183
2184 /* If there are any loose pages, just use them */
2185 if (num == 1 && txn->mt_loose_pgs) {
2186 np = txn->mt_loose_pgs;
2187 txn->mt_loose_pgs = NEXT_LOOSE_PAGE(np);
2188 txn->mt_loose_count--;
2189 DPRINTF(("db %d use loose page %"Z"u", DDBI(mc),
2190 np->mp_pgno));
2191 *mp = np;
2192 return MDB_SUCCESS;
2193 }
2194
2195 *mp = NULL;
2196
2197 /* If our dirty list is already full, we can't do anything */
2198 if (txn->mt_dirty_room == 0) {
2199 rc = MDB_TXN_FULL;
2200 goto fail;
2201 }
2202
2203 for (op = MDB_FIRST;; op = MDB_NEXT) {
2204 MDB_val key, data;
2205 MDB_node *leaf;
2206 pgno_t *idl;
2207
2208 /* Seek a big enough contiguous page range. Prefer
2209 * pages at the tail, just truncating the list.
2210 */
2211 if (mop_len > n2) {
2212 i = mop_len;
2213 do {
2214 pgno = mop[i];
2215 if (mop[i-n2] == pgno+n2)
2216 goto search_done;
2217 } while (--i > n2);
2218 if (--retry < 0)
2219 break;
2220 }
2221
2222 if (op == MDB_FIRST) { /* 1st iteration */
2223 /* Prepare to fetch more and coalesce */
2224 last = env->me_pglast;
2225 oldest = env->me_pgoldest;
2226 mdb_cursor_init(&m2, txn, FREE_DBI, NULL);
2227 if (last) {
2228 op = MDB_SET_RANGE;
2229 key.mv_data = &last; /* will look up last+1 */
2230 key.mv_size = sizeof(last);
2231 }
2232 if (Paranoid && mc->mc_dbi == FREE_DBI)
2233 retry = -1;
2234 }
2235 if (Paranoid && retry < 0 && mop_len)
2236 break;
2237
2238 last++;
2239 /* Do not fetch more if the record will be too recent */
2240 if (oldest <= last) {
2241 if (!found_old) {
2242 oldest = mdb_find_oldest(txn);
2243 env->me_pgoldest = oldest;
2244 found_old = 1;
2245 }
2246 if (oldest <= last)
2247 break;
2248 }
2249 rc = mdb_cursor_get(&m2, &key, NULL, op);
2250 if (rc) {
2251 if (rc == MDB_NOTFOUND)
2252 break;
2253 goto fail;
2254 }
2255 last = *(txnid_t*)key.mv_data;
2256 if (oldest <= last) {
2257 if (!found_old) {
2258 oldest = mdb_find_oldest(txn);
2259 env->me_pgoldest = oldest;
2260 found_old = 1;
2261 }
2262 if (oldest <= last)
2263 break;
2264 }
2265 np = m2.mc_pg[m2.mc_top];
2266 leaf = NODEPTR(np, m2.mc_ki[m2.mc_top]);
2267 if ((rc = mdb_node_read(&m2, leaf, &data)) != MDB_SUCCESS)
2268 goto fail;
2269
2270 idl = (MDB_ID *) data.mv_data;
2271 i = idl[0];
2272 if (!mop) {
2273 if (!(env->me_pghead = mop = mdb_midl_alloc(i))) {
2274 rc = ENOMEM;
2275 goto fail;
2276 }
2277 } else {
2278 if ((rc = mdb_midl_need(&env->me_pghead, i)) != 0)
2279 goto fail;
2280 mop = env->me_pghead;
2281 }
2282 env->me_pglast = last;
2283#if (MDB_DEBUG) > 1
2284 DPRINTF(("IDL read txn %"Z"u root %"Z"u num %u",
2285 last, txn->mt_dbs[FREE_DBI].md_root, i));
2286 for (j = i; j; j--)
2287 DPRINTF(("IDL %"Z"u", idl[j]));
2288#endif
2289 /* Merge in descending sorted order */
2290 mdb_midl_xmerge(mop, idl);
2291 mop_len = mop[0];
2292 }
2293
2294 /* Use new pages from the map when nothing suitable in the freeDB */
2295 i = 0;
2296 pgno = txn->mt_next_pgno;
2297 if (pgno + num >= env->me_maxpg) {
2298 DPUTS("DB size maxed out");
2299 rc = MDB_MAP_FULL;
2300 goto fail;
2301 }
2302
2303search_done:
2304 if (env->me_flags & MDB_WRITEMAP) {
2305 np = (MDB_page *)(env->me_map + env->me_psize * pgno);
2306 } else {
2307 if (!(np = mdb_page_malloc(txn, num))) {
2308 rc = ENOMEM;
2309 goto fail;
2310 }
2311 }
2312 if (i) {
2313 mop[0] = mop_len -= num;
2314 /* Move any stragglers down */
2315 for (j = i-num; j < mop_len; )
2316 mop[++j] = mop[++i];
2317 } else {
2318 txn->mt_next_pgno = pgno + num;
2319 }
2320 np->mp_pgno = pgno;
2321 mdb_page_dirty(txn, np);
2322 *mp = np;
2323
2324 return MDB_SUCCESS;
2325
2326fail:
2327 txn->mt_flags |= MDB_TXN_ERROR;
2328 return rc;
2329}
2330
2336static void
2337mdb_page_copy(MDB_page *dst, MDB_page *src, unsigned int psize)
2338{
2339 enum { Align = sizeof(pgno_t) };
2340 indx_t upper = src->mp_upper, lower = src->mp_lower, unused = upper-lower;
2341
2342 /* If page isn't full, just copy the used portion. Adjust
2343 * alignment so memcpy may copy words instead of bytes.
2344 */
2345 if ((unused &= -Align) && !IS_LEAF2(src)) {
2346 upper = (upper + PAGEBASE) & -Align;
2347 memcpy(dst, src, (lower + PAGEBASE + (Align-1)) & -Align);
2348 memcpy((pgno_t *)((char *)dst+upper), (pgno_t *)((char *)src+upper),
2349 psize - upper);
2350 } else {
2351 memcpy(dst, src, psize - unused);
2352 }
2353}
2354
2363static int
2364mdb_page_unspill(MDB_txn *txn, MDB_page *mp, MDB_page **ret)
2365{
2366 MDB_env *env = txn->mt_env;
2367 const MDB_txn *tx2;
2368 unsigned x;
2369 pgno_t pgno = mp->mp_pgno, pn = pgno << 1;
2370
2371 for (tx2 = txn; tx2; tx2=tx2->mt_parent) {
2372 if (!tx2->mt_spill_pgs)
2373 continue;
2374 x = mdb_midl_search(tx2->mt_spill_pgs, pn);
2375 if (x <= tx2->mt_spill_pgs[0] && tx2->mt_spill_pgs[x] == pn) {
2376 MDB_page *np;
2377 int num;
2378 if (txn->mt_dirty_room == 0)
2379 return MDB_TXN_FULL;
2380 if (IS_OVERFLOW(mp))
2381 num = mp->mp_pages;
2382 else
2383 num = 1;
2384 if (env->me_flags & MDB_WRITEMAP) {
2385 np = mp;
2386 } else {
2387 np = mdb_page_malloc(txn, num);
2388 if (!np)
2389 return ENOMEM;
2390 if (num > 1)
2391 memcpy(np, mp, num * env->me_psize);
2392 else
2393 mdb_page_copy(np, mp, env->me_psize);
2394 }
2395 if (tx2 == txn) {
2396 /* If in current txn, this page is no longer spilled.
2397 * If it happens to be the last page, truncate the spill list.
2398 * Otherwise mark it as deleted by setting the LSB.
2399 */
2400 if (x == txn->mt_spill_pgs[0])
2401 txn->mt_spill_pgs[0]--;
2402 else
2403 txn->mt_spill_pgs[x] |= 1;
2404 } /* otherwise, if belonging to a parent txn, the
2405 * page remains spilled until child commits
2406 */
2407
2408 mdb_page_dirty(txn, np);
2409 np->mp_flags |= P_DIRTY;
2410 *ret = np;
2411 break;
2412 }
2413 }
2414 return MDB_SUCCESS;
2415}
2416
2422static int
2423mdb_page_touch(MDB_cursor *mc)
2424{
2425 MDB_page *mp = mc->mc_pg[mc->mc_top], *np;
2426 MDB_txn *txn = mc->mc_txn;
2427 MDB_cursor *m2, *m3;
2428 pgno_t pgno;
2429 int rc;
2430
2431 if (!F_ISSET(mp->mp_flags, P_DIRTY)) {
2432 if (txn->mt_flags & MDB_TXN_SPILLS) {
2433 np = NULL;
2434 rc = mdb_page_unspill(txn, mp, &np);
2435 if (rc)
2436 goto fail;
2437 if (np)
2438 goto done;
2439 }
2440 if ((rc = mdb_midl_need(&txn->mt_free_pgs, 1)) ||
2441 (rc = mdb_page_alloc(mc, 1, &np)))
2442 goto fail;
2443 pgno = np->mp_pgno;
2444 DPRINTF(("touched db %d page %"Z"u -> %"Z"u", DDBI(mc),
2445 mp->mp_pgno, pgno));
2446 mdb_cassert(mc, mp->mp_pgno != pgno);
2447 mdb_midl_xappend(txn->mt_free_pgs, mp->mp_pgno);
2448 /* Update the parent page, if any, to point to the new page */
2449 if (mc->mc_top) {
2450 MDB_page *parent = mc->mc_pg[mc->mc_top-1];
2451 MDB_node *node = NODEPTR(parent, mc->mc_ki[mc->mc_top-1]);
2452 SETPGNO(node, pgno);
2453 } else {
2454 mc->mc_db->md_root = pgno;
2455 }
2456 } else if (txn->mt_parent && !IS_SUBP(mp)) {
2457 MDB_ID2 mid, *dl = txn->mt_u.dirty_list;
2458 pgno = mp->mp_pgno;
2459 /* If txn has a parent, make sure the page is in our
2460 * dirty list.
2461 */
2462 if (dl[0].mid) {
2463 unsigned x = mdb_mid2l_search(dl, pgno);
2464 if (x <= dl[0].mid && dl[x].mid == pgno) {
2465 if (mp != dl[x].mptr) { /* bad cursor? */
2466 mc->mc_flags &= ~(C_INITIALIZED|C_EOF);
2467 txn->mt_flags |= MDB_TXN_ERROR;
2468 return MDB_CORRUPTED;
2469 }
2470 return 0;
2471 }
2472 }
2473 mdb_cassert(mc, dl[0].mid < MDB_IDL_UM_MAX);
2474 /* No - copy it */
2475 np = mdb_page_malloc(txn, 1);
2476 if (!np)
2477 return ENOMEM;
2478 mid.mid = pgno;
2479 mid.mptr = np;
2480 rc = mdb_mid2l_insert(dl, &mid);
2481 mdb_cassert(mc, rc == 0);
2482 } else {
2483 return 0;
2484 }
2485
2486 mdb_page_copy(np, mp, txn->mt_env->me_psize);
2487 np->mp_pgno = pgno;
2488 np->mp_flags |= P_DIRTY;
2489
2490done:
2491 /* Adjust cursors pointing to mp */
2492 mc->mc_pg[mc->mc_top] = np;
2493 m2 = txn->mt_cursors[mc->mc_dbi];
2494 if (mc->mc_flags & C_SUB) {
2495 for (; m2; m2=m2->mc_next) {
2496 m3 = &m2->mc_xcursor->mx_cursor;
2497 if (m3->mc_snum < mc->mc_snum) continue;
2498 if (m3->mc_pg[mc->mc_top] == mp)
2499 m3->mc_pg[mc->mc_top] = np;
2500 }
2501 } else {
2502 for (; m2; m2=m2->mc_next) {
2503 if (m2->mc_snum < mc->mc_snum) continue;
2504 if (m2 == mc) continue;
2505 if (m2->mc_pg[mc->mc_top] == mp) {
2506 m2->mc_pg[mc->mc_top] = np;
2507 if (IS_LEAF(np))
2508 XCURSOR_REFRESH(m2, mc->mc_top, np);
2509 }
2510 }
2511 }
2512 return 0;
2513
2514fail:
2515 txn->mt_flags |= MDB_TXN_ERROR;
2516 return rc;
2517}
2518
2519int
2520mdb_env_sync(MDB_env *env, int force)
2521{
2522 int rc = 0;
2523 if (env->me_flags & MDB_RDONLY)
2524 return EACCES;
2525 if (force || !F_ISSET(env->me_flags, MDB_NOSYNC)) {
2526 if (env->me_flags & MDB_WRITEMAP) {
2527 int flags = ((env->me_flags & MDB_MAPASYNC) && !force)
2528 ? MS_ASYNC : MS_SYNC;
2529 if (MDB_MSYNC(env->me_map, env->me_mapsize, flags))
2530 rc = ErrCode();
2531#ifdef _WIN32
2532 else if (flags == MS_SYNC && MDB_FDATASYNC(env->me_fd))
2533 rc = ErrCode();
2534#endif
2535 } else {
2536#ifdef BROKEN_FDATASYNC
2537 if (env->me_flags & MDB_FSYNCONLY) {
2538 if (fsync(env->me_fd))
2539 rc = ErrCode();
2540 } else
2541#endif
2542 if (MDB_FDATASYNC(env->me_fd))
2543 rc = ErrCode();
2544 }
2545 }
2546 return rc;
2547}
2548
2550static int
2551mdb_cursor_shadow(MDB_txn *src, MDB_txn *dst)
2552{
2553 MDB_cursor *mc, *bk;
2554 MDB_xcursor *mx;
2555 size_t size;
2556 int i;
2557
2558 for (i = src->mt_numdbs; --i >= 0; ) {
2559 if ((mc = src->mt_cursors[i]) != NULL) {
2560 size = sizeof(MDB_cursor);
2561 if (mc->mc_xcursor)
2562 size += sizeof(MDB_xcursor);
2563 for (; mc; mc = bk->mc_next) {
2564 bk = malloc(size);
2565 if (!bk)
2566 return ENOMEM;
2567 *bk = *mc;
2568 mc->mc_backup = bk;
2569 mc->mc_db = &dst->mt_dbs[i];
2570 /* Kill pointers into src to reduce abuse: The
2571 * user may not use mc until dst ends. But we need a valid
2572 * txn pointer here for cursor fixups to keep working.
2573 */
2574 mc->mc_txn = dst;
2575 mc->mc_dbflag = &dst->mt_dbflags[i];
2576 if ((mx = mc->mc_xcursor) != NULL) {
2577 *(MDB_xcursor *)(bk+1) = *mx;
2578 mx->mx_cursor.mc_txn = dst;
2579 }
2580 mc->mc_next = dst->mt_cursors[i];
2581 dst->mt_cursors[i] = mc;
2582 }
2583 }
2584 }
2585 return MDB_SUCCESS;
2586}
2587
2593static void
2594mdb_cursors_close(MDB_txn *txn, unsigned merge)
2595{
2596 MDB_cursor **cursors = txn->mt_cursors, *mc, *next, *bk;
2597 MDB_xcursor *mx;
2598 int i;
2599
2600 for (i = txn->mt_numdbs; --i >= 0; ) {
2601 for (mc = cursors[i]; mc; mc = next) {
2602 next = mc->mc_next;
2603 if ((bk = mc->mc_backup) != NULL) {
2604 if (merge) {
2605 /* Commit changes to parent txn */
2606 mc->mc_next = bk->mc_next;
2607 mc->mc_backup = bk->mc_backup;
2608 mc->mc_txn = bk->mc_txn;
2609 mc->mc_db = bk->mc_db;
2610 mc->mc_dbflag = bk->mc_dbflag;
2611 if ((mx = mc->mc_xcursor) != NULL)
2612 mx->mx_cursor.mc_txn = bk->mc_txn;
2613 } else {
2614 /* Abort nested txn */
2615 *mc = *bk;
2616 if ((mx = mc->mc_xcursor) != NULL)
2617 *mx = *(MDB_xcursor *)(bk+1);
2618 }
2619 mc = bk;
2620 }
2621 /* Only malloced cursors are permanently tracked. */
2622 free(mc);
2623 }
2624 cursors[i] = NULL;
2625 }
2626}
2627
2628#if !(MDB_PIDLOCK) /* Currently the same as defined(_WIN32) */
2629enum Pidlock_op {
2630 Pidset, Pidcheck
2631};
2632#else
2633enum Pidlock_op {
2634 Pidset = F_SETLK, Pidcheck = F_GETLK
2635};
2636#endif
2637
2646static int
2647mdb_reader_pid(MDB_env *env, enum Pidlock_op op, MDB_PID_T pid)
2648{
2649#if !(MDB_PIDLOCK) /* Currently the same as defined(_WIN32) */
2650 int ret = 0;
2651 HANDLE h;
2652 if (op == Pidcheck) {
2653 h = OpenProcess(env->me_pidquery, FALSE, pid);
2654 /* No documented "no such process" code, but other program use this: */
2655 if (!h)
2656 return ErrCode() != ERROR_INVALID_PARAMETER;
2657 /* A process exists until all handles to it close. Has it exited? */
2658 ret = WaitForSingleObject(h, 0) != 0;
2659 CloseHandle(h);
2660 }
2661 return ret;
2662#else
2663 for (;;) {
2664 int rc;
2665 struct flock lock_info;
2666 memset(&lock_info, 0, sizeof(lock_info));
2667 lock_info.l_type = F_WRLCK;
2668 lock_info.l_whence = SEEK_SET;
2669 lock_info.l_start = pid;
2670 lock_info.l_len = 1;
2671 if ((rc = fcntl(env->me_lfd, op, &lock_info)) == 0) {
2672 if (op == F_GETLK && lock_info.l_type != F_UNLCK)
2673 rc = -1;
2674 } else if ((rc = ErrCode()) == EINTR) {
2675 continue;
2676 }
2677 return rc;
2678 }
2679#endif
2680}
2681
2686static int
2687mdb_txn_renew0(MDB_txn *txn)
2688{
2689 MDB_env *env = txn->mt_env;
2690 MDB_txninfo *ti = env->me_txns;
2691 MDB_meta *meta;
2692 unsigned int i, nr, flags = txn->mt_flags;
2693 uint16_t x;
2694 int rc, new_notls = 0;
2695
2696 if ((flags &= MDB_TXN_RDONLY) != 0) {
2697 if (!ti) {
2698 meta = mdb_env_pick_meta(env);
2699 txn->mt_txnid = meta->mm_txnid;
2700 txn->mt_u.reader = NULL;
2701 } else {
2702 MDB_reader *r = (env->me_flags & MDB_NOTLS) ? txn->mt_u.reader :
2703 pthread_getspecific(env->me_txkey);
2704 if (r) {
2705 if (r->mr_pid != env->me_pid || r->mr_txnid != (txnid_t)-1)
2706 return MDB_BAD_RSLOT;
2707 } else {
2708 MDB_PID_T pid = env->me_pid;
2709 MDB_THR_T tid = pthread_self();
2710 mdb_mutexref_t rmutex = env->me_rmutex;
2711
2712 if (!env->me_live_reader) {
2713 rc = mdb_reader_pid(env, Pidset, pid);
2714 if (rc)
2715 return rc;
2716 env->me_live_reader = 1;
2717 }
2718
2719 if (LOCK_MUTEX(rc, env, rmutex))
2720 return rc;
2721 nr = ti->mti_numreaders;
2722 for (i=0; i<nr; i++)
2723 if (ti->mti_readers[i].mr_pid == 0)
2724 break;
2725 if (i == env->me_maxreaders) {
2726 UNLOCK_MUTEX(rmutex);
2727 return MDB_READERS_FULL;
2728 }
2729 r = &ti->mti_readers[i];
2730 /* Claim the reader slot, carefully since other code
2731 * uses the reader table un-mutexed: First reset the
2732 * slot, next publish it in mti_numreaders. After
2733 * that, it is safe for mdb_env_close() to touch it.
2734 * When it will be closed, we can finally claim it.
2735 */
2736 r->mr_pid = 0;
2737 r->mr_txnid = (txnid_t)-1;
2738 r->mr_tid = tid;
2739 if (i == nr)
2740 ti->mti_numreaders = ++nr;
2741 env->me_close_readers = nr;
2742 r->mr_pid = pid;
2743 UNLOCK_MUTEX(rmutex);
2744
2745 new_notls = (env->me_flags & MDB_NOTLS);
2746 if (!new_notls && (rc=pthread_setspecific(env->me_txkey, r))) {
2747 r->mr_pid = 0;
2748 return rc;
2749 }
2750 }
2751 do /* LY: Retry on a race, ITS#7970. */
2752 r->mr_txnid = ti->mti_txnid;
2753 while(r->mr_txnid != ti->mti_txnid);
2754 txn->mt_txnid = r->mr_txnid;
2755 txn->mt_u.reader = r;
2756 meta = env->me_metas[txn->mt_txnid & 1];
2757 }
2758
2759 } else {
2760 /* Not yet touching txn == env->me_txn0, it may be active */
2761 if (ti) {
2762 if (LOCK_MUTEX(rc, env, env->me_wmutex))
2763 return rc;
2764 txn->mt_txnid = ti->mti_txnid;
2765 meta = env->me_metas[txn->mt_txnid & 1];
2766 } else {
2767 meta = mdb_env_pick_meta(env);
2768 txn->mt_txnid = meta->mm_txnid;
2769 }
2770 txn->mt_txnid++;
2771#if MDB_DEBUG
2772 if (txn->mt_txnid == mdb_debug_start)
2773 mdb_debug = 1;
2774#endif
2775 txn->mt_child = NULL;
2776 txn->mt_loose_pgs = NULL;
2777 txn->mt_loose_count = 0;
2778 txn->mt_dirty_room = MDB_IDL_UM_MAX;
2779 txn->mt_u.dirty_list = env->me_dirty_list;
2780 txn->mt_u.dirty_list[0].mid = 0;
2781 txn->mt_free_pgs = env->me_free_pgs;
2782 txn->mt_free_pgs[0] = 0;
2783 txn->mt_spill_pgs = NULL;
2784 env->me_txn = txn;
2785 memcpy(txn->mt_dbiseqs, env->me_dbiseqs, env->me_maxdbs * sizeof(unsigned int));
2786 }
2787
2788 /* Copy the DB info and flags */
2789 memcpy(txn->mt_dbs, meta->mm_dbs, CORE_DBS * sizeof(MDB_db));
2790
2791 /* Moved to here to avoid a data race in read TXNs */
2792 txn->mt_next_pgno = meta->mm_last_pg+1;
2793
2794 txn->mt_flags = flags;
2795
2796 /* Setup db info */
2797 txn->mt_numdbs = env->me_numdbs;
2798 for (i=CORE_DBS; i<txn->mt_numdbs; i++) {
2799 x = env->me_dbflags[i];
2800 txn->mt_dbs[i].md_flags = x & PERSISTENT_FLAGS;
2801 txn->mt_dbflags[i] = (x & MDB_VALID) ? DB_VALID|DB_USRVALID|DB_STALE : 0;
2802 }
2803 txn->mt_dbflags[MAIN_DBI] = DB_VALID|DB_USRVALID;
2804 txn->mt_dbflags[FREE_DBI] = DB_VALID;
2805
2806 if (env->me_flags & MDB_FATAL_ERROR) {
2807 DPUTS("environment had fatal error, must shutdown!");
2808 rc = MDB_PANIC;
2809 } else if (env->me_maxpg < txn->mt_next_pgno) {
2810 rc = MDB_MAP_RESIZED;
2811 } else {
2812 return MDB_SUCCESS;
2813 }
2814 mdb_txn_end(txn, new_notls /*0 or MDB_END_SLOT*/ | MDB_END_FAIL_BEGIN);
2815 return rc;
2816}
2817
2818int
2819mdb_txn_renew(MDB_txn *txn)
2820{
2821 int rc;
2822
2823 if (!txn || !F_ISSET(txn->mt_flags, MDB_TXN_RDONLY|MDB_TXN_FINISHED))
2824 return EINVAL;
2825
2826 rc = mdb_txn_renew0(txn);
2827 if (rc == MDB_SUCCESS) {
2828 DPRINTF(("renew txn %"Z"u%c %p on mdbenv %p, root page %"Z"u",
2829 txn->mt_txnid, (txn->mt_flags & MDB_TXN_RDONLY) ? 'r' : 'w',
2830 (void *)txn, (void *)txn->mt_env, txn->mt_dbs[MAIN_DBI].md_root));
2831 }
2832 return rc;
2833}
2834
2835int
2836mdb_txn_begin(MDB_env *env, MDB_txn *parent, unsigned int flags, MDB_txn **ret)
2837{
2838 MDB_txn *txn;
2839 MDB_ntxn *ntxn;
2840 int rc, size, tsize;
2841
2842 flags &= MDB_TXN_BEGIN_FLAGS;
2843 flags |= env->me_flags & MDB_WRITEMAP;
2844
2845 if (env->me_flags & MDB_RDONLY & ~flags) /* write txn in RDONLY env */
2846 return EACCES;
2847
2848 if (parent) {
2849 /* Nested transactions: Max 1 child, write txns only, no writemap */
2850 flags |= parent->mt_flags;
2851 if (flags & (MDB_RDONLY|MDB_WRITEMAP|MDB_TXN_BLOCKED)) {
2852 return (parent->mt_flags & MDB_TXN_RDONLY) ? EINVAL : MDB_BAD_TXN;
2853 }
2854 /* Child txns save MDB_pgstate and use own copy of cursors */
2855 size = env->me_maxdbs * (sizeof(MDB_db)+sizeof(MDB_cursor *)+1);
2856 size += tsize = sizeof(MDB_ntxn);
2857 } else if (flags & MDB_RDONLY) {
2858 size = env->me_maxdbs * (sizeof(MDB_db)+1);
2859 size += tsize = sizeof(MDB_txn);
2860 } else {
2861 /* Reuse preallocated write txn. However, do not touch it until
2862 * mdb_txn_renew0() succeeds, since it currently may be active.
2863 */
2864 txn = env->me_txn0;
2865 goto renew;
2866 }
2867 if ((txn = calloc(1, size)) == NULL) {
2868 DPRINTF(("calloc: %s", strerror(errno)));
2869 return ENOMEM;
2870 }
2871 txn->mt_dbxs = env->me_dbxs; /* static */
2872 txn->mt_dbs = (MDB_db *) ((char *)txn + tsize);
2873 txn->mt_dbflags = (unsigned char *)txn + size - env->me_maxdbs;
2874 txn->mt_flags = flags;
2875 txn->mt_env = env;
2876
2877 if (parent) {
2878 unsigned int i;
2879 txn->mt_cursors = (MDB_cursor **)(txn->mt_dbs + env->me_maxdbs);
2880 txn->mt_dbiseqs = parent->mt_dbiseqs;
2881 txn->mt_u.dirty_list = malloc(sizeof(MDB_ID2)*MDB_IDL_UM_SIZE);
2882 if (!txn->mt_u.dirty_list ||
2883 !(txn->mt_free_pgs = mdb_midl_alloc(MDB_IDL_UM_MAX)))
2884 {
2885 free(txn->mt_u.dirty_list);
2886 free(txn);
2887 return ENOMEM;
2888 }
2889 txn->mt_txnid = parent->mt_txnid;
2890 txn->mt_dirty_room = parent->mt_dirty_room;
2891 txn->mt_u.dirty_list[0].mid = 0;
2892 txn->mt_spill_pgs = NULL;
2893 txn->mt_next_pgno = parent->mt_next_pgno;
2894 parent->mt_flags |= MDB_TXN_HAS_CHILD;
2895 parent->mt_child = txn;
2896 txn->mt_parent = parent;
2897 txn->mt_numdbs = parent->mt_numdbs;
2898 memcpy(txn->mt_dbs, parent->mt_dbs, txn->mt_numdbs * sizeof(MDB_db));
2899 /* Copy parent's mt_dbflags, but clear DB_NEW */
2900 for (i=0; i<txn->mt_numdbs; i++)
2901 txn->mt_dbflags[i] = parent->mt_dbflags[i] & ~DB_NEW;
2902 rc = 0;
2903 ntxn = (MDB_ntxn *)txn;
2904 ntxn->mnt_pgstate = env->me_pgstate; /* save parent me_pghead & co */
2905 if (env->me_pghead) {
2906 size = MDB_IDL_SIZEOF(env->me_pghead);
2907 env->me_pghead = mdb_midl_alloc(env->me_pghead[0]);
2908 if (env->me_pghead)
2909 memcpy(env->me_pghead, ntxn->mnt_pgstate.mf_pghead, size);
2910 else
2911 rc = ENOMEM;
2912 }
2913 if (!rc)
2914 rc = mdb_cursor_shadow(parent, txn);
2915 if (rc)
2916 mdb_txn_end(txn, MDB_END_FAIL_BEGINCHILD);
2917 } else { /* MDB_RDONLY */
2918 txn->mt_dbiseqs = env->me_dbiseqs;
2919renew:
2920 rc = mdb_txn_renew0(txn);
2921 }
2922 if (rc) {
2923 if (txn != env->me_txn0)
2924 free(txn);
2925 } else {
2926 txn->mt_flags |= flags; /* could not change txn=me_txn0 earlier */
2927 *ret = txn;
2928 DPRINTF(("begin txn %"Z"u%c %p on mdbenv %p, root page %"Z"u",
2929 txn->mt_txnid, (flags & MDB_RDONLY) ? 'r' : 'w',
2930 (void *) txn, (void *) env, txn->mt_dbs[MAIN_DBI].md_root));
2931 }
2932
2933 return rc;
2934}
2935
2936MDB_env *
2937mdb_txn_env(MDB_txn *txn)
2938{
2939 if(!txn) return NULL;
2940 return txn->mt_env;
2941}
2942
2943size_t
2944mdb_txn_id(MDB_txn *txn)
2945{
2946 if(!txn) return 0;
2947 return txn->mt_txnid;
2948}
2949
2951static void
2952mdb_dbis_update(MDB_txn *txn, int keep)
2953{
2954 int i;
2955 MDB_dbi n = txn->mt_numdbs;
2956 MDB_env *env = txn->mt_env;
2957 unsigned char *tdbflags = txn->mt_dbflags;
2958
2959 for (i = n; --i >= CORE_DBS;) {
2960 if (tdbflags[i] & DB_NEW) {
2961 if (keep) {
2962 env->me_dbflags[i] = txn->mt_dbs[i].md_flags | MDB_VALID;
2963 } else {
2964 char *ptr = env->me_dbxs[i].md_name.mv_data;
2965 if (ptr) {
2966 env->me_dbxs[i].md_name.mv_data = NULL;
2967 env->me_dbxs[i].md_name.mv_size = 0;
2968 env->me_dbflags[i] = 0;
2969 env->me_dbiseqs[i]++;
2970 free(ptr);
2971 }
2972 }
2973 }
2974 }
2975 if (keep && env->me_numdbs < n)
2976 env->me_numdbs = n;
2977}
2978
2984static void
2985mdb_txn_end(MDB_txn *txn, unsigned mode)
2986{
2987 MDB_env *env = txn->mt_env;
2988#if MDB_DEBUG
2989 static const char *const names[] = MDB_END_NAMES;
2990#endif
2991
2992 /* Export or close DBI handles opened in this txn */
2993 mdb_dbis_update(txn, mode & MDB_END_UPDATE);
2994
2995 DPRINTF(("%s txn %"Z"u%c %p on mdbenv %p, root page %"Z"u",
2996 names[mode & MDB_END_OPMASK],
2997 txn->mt_txnid, (txn->mt_flags & MDB_TXN_RDONLY) ? 'r' : 'w',
2998 (void *) txn, (void *)env, txn->mt_dbs[MAIN_DBI].md_root));
2999
3000 if (F_ISSET(txn->mt_flags, MDB_TXN_RDONLY)) {
3001 if (txn->mt_u.reader) {
3002 txn->mt_u.reader->mr_txnid = (txnid_t)-1;
3003 if (!(env->me_flags & MDB_NOTLS)) {
3004 txn->mt_u.reader = NULL; /* txn does not own reader */
3005 } else if (mode & MDB_END_SLOT) {
3006 txn->mt_u.reader->mr_pid = 0;
3007 txn->mt_u.reader = NULL;
3008 } /* else txn owns the slot until it does MDB_END_SLOT */
3009 }
3010 txn->mt_numdbs = 0; /* prevent further DBI activity */
3011 txn->mt_flags |= MDB_TXN_FINISHED;
3012
3013 } else if (!F_ISSET(txn->mt_flags, MDB_TXN_FINISHED)) {
3014 pgno_t *pghead = env->me_pghead;
3015
3016 if (!(mode & MDB_END_UPDATE)) /* !(already closed cursors) */
3017 mdb_cursors_close(txn, 0);
3018 if (!(env->me_flags & MDB_WRITEMAP)) {
3019 mdb_dlist_free(txn);
3020 }
3021
3022 txn->mt_numdbs = 0;
3023 txn->mt_flags = MDB_TXN_FINISHED;
3024
3025 if (!txn->mt_parent) {
3026 mdb_midl_shrink(&txn->mt_free_pgs);
3027 env->me_free_pgs = txn->mt_free_pgs;
3028 /* me_pgstate: */
3029 env->me_pghead = NULL;
3030 env->me_pglast = 0;
3031
3032 env->me_txn = NULL;
3033 mode = 0; /* txn == env->me_txn0, do not free() it */
3034
3035 /* The writer mutex was locked in mdb_txn_begin. */
3036 if (env->me_txns)
3037 UNLOCK_MUTEX(env->me_wmutex);
3038 } else {
3039 txn->mt_parent->mt_child = NULL;
3040 txn->mt_parent->mt_flags &= ~MDB_TXN_HAS_CHILD;
3041 env->me_pgstate = ((MDB_ntxn *)txn)->mnt_pgstate;
3042 mdb_midl_free(txn->mt_free_pgs);
3043 free(txn->mt_u.dirty_list);
3044 }
3045 mdb_midl_free(txn->mt_spill_pgs);
3046
3047 mdb_midl_free(pghead);
3048 }
3049
3050 if (mode & MDB_END_FREE)
3051 free(txn);
3052}
3053
3054void
3055mdb_txn_reset(MDB_txn *txn)
3056{
3057 if (txn == NULL)
3058 return;
3059
3060 /* This call is only valid for read-only txns */
3061 if (!(txn->mt_flags & MDB_TXN_RDONLY))
3062 return;
3063
3064 mdb_txn_end(txn, MDB_END_RESET);
3065}
3066
3067void
3068mdb_txn_abort(MDB_txn *txn)
3069{
3070 if (txn == NULL)
3071 return;
3072
3073 if (txn->mt_child)
3074 mdb_txn_abort(txn->mt_child);
3075
3076 mdb_txn_end(txn, MDB_END_ABORT|MDB_END_SLOT|MDB_END_FREE);
3077}
3078
3082static int
3083mdb_freelist_save(MDB_txn *txn)
3084{
3085 /* env->me_pghead[] can grow and shrink during this call.
3086 * env->me_pglast and txn->mt_free_pgs[] can only grow.
3087 * Page numbers cannot disappear from txn->mt_free_pgs[].
3088 */
3089 MDB_cursor mc;
3090 MDB_env *env = txn->mt_env;
3091 int rc, maxfree_1pg = env->me_maxfree_1pg, more = 1;
3092 txnid_t pglast = 0, head_id = 0;
3093 pgno_t freecnt = 0, *free_pgs, *mop;
3094 ssize_t head_room = 0, total_room = 0, mop_len, clean_limit;
3095
3096 mdb_cursor_init(&mc, txn, FREE_DBI, NULL);
3097
3098 if (env->me_pghead) {
3099 /* Make sure first page of freeDB is touched and on freelist */
3100 rc = mdb_page_search(&mc, NULL, MDB_PS_FIRST|MDB_PS_MODIFY);
3101 if (rc && rc != MDB_NOTFOUND)
3102 return rc;
3103 }
3104
3105 if (!env->me_pghead && txn->mt_loose_pgs) {
3106 /* Put loose page numbers in mt_free_pgs, since
3107 * we may be unable to return them to me_pghead.
3108 */
3109 MDB_page *mp = txn->mt_loose_pgs;
3110 MDB_ID2 *dl = txn->mt_u.dirty_list;
3111 unsigned x;
3112 if ((rc = mdb_midl_need(&txn->mt_free_pgs, txn->mt_loose_count)) != 0)
3113 return rc;
3114 for (; mp; mp = NEXT_LOOSE_PAGE(mp)) {
3115 mdb_midl_xappend(txn->mt_free_pgs, mp->mp_pgno);
3116 /* must also remove from dirty list */
3117 if (txn->mt_flags & MDB_TXN_WRITEMAP) {
3118 for (x=1; x<=dl[0].mid; x++)
3119 if (dl[x].mid == mp->mp_pgno)
3120 break;
3121 mdb_tassert(txn, x <= dl[0].mid);
3122 } else {
3123 x = mdb_mid2l_search(dl, mp->mp_pgno);
3124 mdb_tassert(txn, dl[x].mid == mp->mp_pgno);
3125 mdb_dpage_free(env, mp);
3126 }
3127 dl[x].mptr = NULL;
3128 }
3129 {
3130 /* squash freed slots out of the dirty list */
3131 unsigned y;
3132 for (y=1; dl[y].mptr && y <= dl[0].mid; y++);
3133 if (y <= dl[0].mid) {
3134 for(x=y, y++;;) {
3135 while (!dl[y].mptr && y <= dl[0].mid) y++;
3136 if (y > dl[0].mid) break;
3137 dl[x++] = dl[y++];
3138 }
3139 dl[0].mid = x-1;
3140 } else {
3141 /* all slots freed */
3142 dl[0].mid = 0;
3143 }
3144 }
3145 txn->mt_loose_pgs = NULL;
3146 txn->mt_loose_count = 0;
3147 }
3148
3149 /* MDB_RESERVE cancels meminit in ovpage malloc (when no WRITEMAP) */
3150 clean_limit = (env->me_flags & (MDB_NOMEMINIT|MDB_WRITEMAP))
3151 ? SSIZE_MAX : maxfree_1pg;
3152
3153 for (;;) {
3154 /* Come back here after each Put() in case freelist changed */
3155 MDB_val key, data;
3156 pgno_t *pgs;
3157 ssize_t j;
3158
3159 /* If using records from freeDB which we have not yet
3160 * deleted, delete them and any we reserved for me_pghead.
3161 */
3162 while (pglast < env->me_pglast) {
3163 rc = mdb_cursor_first(&mc, &key, NULL);
3164 if (rc)
3165 return rc;
3166 pglast = head_id = *(txnid_t *)key.mv_data;
3167 total_room = head_room = 0;
3168 mdb_tassert(txn, pglast <= env->me_pglast);
3169 rc = mdb_cursor_del(&mc, 0);
3170 if (rc)
3171 return rc;
3172 }
3173
3174 /* Save the IDL of pages freed by this txn, to a single record */
3175 if (freecnt < txn->mt_free_pgs[0]) {
3176 if (!freecnt) {
3177 /* Make sure last page of freeDB is touched and on freelist */
3178 rc = mdb_page_search(&mc, NULL, MDB_PS_LAST|MDB_PS_MODIFY);
3179 if (rc && rc != MDB_NOTFOUND)
3180 return rc;
3181 }
3182 free_pgs = txn->mt_free_pgs;
3183 /* Write to last page of freeDB */
3184 key.mv_size = sizeof(txn->mt_txnid);
3185 key.mv_data = &txn->mt_txnid;
3186 do {
3187 freecnt = free_pgs[0];
3188 data.mv_size = MDB_IDL_SIZEOF(free_pgs);
3189 rc = mdb_cursor_put(&mc, &key, &data, MDB_RESERVE);
3190 if (rc)
3191 return rc;
3192 /* Retry if mt_free_pgs[] grew during the Put() */
3193 free_pgs = txn->mt_free_pgs;
3194 } while (freecnt < free_pgs[0]);
3195 mdb_midl_sort(free_pgs);
3196 memcpy(data.mv_data, free_pgs, data.mv_size);
3197#if (MDB_DEBUG) > 1
3198 {
3199 unsigned int i = free_pgs[0];
3200 DPRINTF(("IDL write txn %"Z"u root %"Z"u num %u",
3201 txn->mt_txnid, txn->mt_dbs[FREE_DBI].md_root, i));
3202 for (; i; i--)
3203 DPRINTF(("IDL %"Z"u", free_pgs[i]));
3204 }
3205#endif
3206 continue;
3207 }
3208
3209 mop = env->me_pghead;
3210 mop_len = (mop ? mop[0] : 0) + txn->mt_loose_count;
3211
3212 /* Reserve records for me_pghead[]. Split it if multi-page,
3213 * to avoid searching freeDB for a page range. Use keys in
3214 * range [1,me_pglast]: Smaller than txnid of oldest reader.
3215 */
3216 if (total_room >= mop_len) {
3217 if (total_room == mop_len || --more < 0)
3218 break;
3219 } else if (head_room >= maxfree_1pg && head_id > 1) {
3220 /* Keep current record (overflow page), add a new one */
3221 head_id--;
3222 head_room = 0;
3223 }
3224 /* (Re)write {key = head_id, IDL length = head_room} */
3225 total_room -= head_room;
3226 head_room = mop_len - total_room;
3227 if (head_room > maxfree_1pg && head_id > 1) {
3228 /* Overflow multi-page for part of me_pghead */
3229 head_room /= head_id; /* amortize page sizes */
3230 head_room += maxfree_1pg - head_room % (maxfree_1pg + 1);
3231 } else if (head_room < 0) {
3232 /* Rare case, not bothering to delete this record */
3233 head_room = 0;
3234 }
3235 key.mv_size = sizeof(head_id);
3236 key.mv_data = &head_id;
3237 data.mv_size = (head_room + 1) * sizeof(pgno_t);
3238 rc = mdb_cursor_put(&mc, &key, &data, MDB_RESERVE);
3239 if (rc)
3240 return rc;
3241 /* IDL is initially empty, zero out at least the length */
3242 pgs = (pgno_t *)data.mv_data;
3243 j = head_room > clean_limit ? head_room : 0;
3244 do {
3245 pgs[j] = 0;
3246 } while (--j >= 0);
3247 total_room += head_room;
3248 }
3249
3250 /* Return loose page numbers to me_pghead, though usually none are
3251 * left at this point. The pages themselves remain in dirty_list.
3252 */
3253 if (txn->mt_loose_pgs) {
3254 MDB_page *mp = txn->mt_loose_pgs;
3255 unsigned count = txn->mt_loose_count;
3256 MDB_IDL loose;
3257 /* Room for loose pages + temp IDL with same */
3258 if ((rc = mdb_midl_need(&env->me_pghead, 2*count+1)) != 0)
3259 return rc;
3260 mop = env->me_pghead;
3261 loose = mop + MDB_IDL_ALLOCLEN(mop) - count;
3262 for (count = 0; mp; mp = NEXT_LOOSE_PAGE(mp))
3263 loose[ ++count ] = mp->mp_pgno;
3264 loose[0] = count;
3265 mdb_midl_sort(loose);
3266 mdb_midl_xmerge(mop, loose);
3267 txn->mt_loose_pgs = NULL;
3268 txn->mt_loose_count = 0;
3269 mop_len = mop[0];
3270 }
3271
3272 /* Fill in the reserved me_pghead records */
3273 rc = MDB_SUCCESS;
3274 if (mop_len) {
3275 MDB_val key, data;
3276
3277 mop += mop_len;
3278 rc = mdb_cursor_first(&mc, &key, &data);
3279 for (; !rc; rc = mdb_cursor_next(&mc, &key, &data, MDB_NEXT)) {
3280 txnid_t id = *(txnid_t *)key.mv_data;
3281 ssize_t len = (ssize_t)(data.mv_size / sizeof(MDB_ID)) - 1;
3282 MDB_ID save;
3283
3284 mdb_tassert(txn, len >= 0 && id <= env->me_pglast);
3285 key.mv_data = &id;
3286 if (len > mop_len) {
3287 len = mop_len;
3288 data.mv_size = (len + 1) * sizeof(MDB_ID);
3289 }
3290 data.mv_data = mop -= len;
3291 save = mop[0];
3292 mop[0] = len;
3293 rc = mdb_cursor_put(&mc, &key, &data, MDB_CURRENT);
3294 mop[0] = save;
3295 if (rc || !(mop_len -= len))
3296 break;
3297 }
3298 }
3299 return rc;
3300}
3301
3307static int
3308mdb_page_flush(MDB_txn *txn, int keep)
3309{
3310 MDB_env *env = txn->mt_env;
3311 MDB_ID2L dl = txn->mt_u.dirty_list;
3312 unsigned psize = env->me_psize, j;
3313 int i, pagecount = dl[0].mid, rc;
3314 size_t size = 0, pos = 0;
3315 pgno_t pgno = 0;
3316 MDB_page *dp = NULL;
3317#ifdef _WIN32
3318 OVERLAPPED ov;
3319#else
3320 struct iovec iov[MDB_COMMIT_PAGES];
3321 ssize_t wpos = 0, wsize = 0, wres;
3322 size_t next_pos = 1; /* impossible pos, so pos != next_pos */
3323 int n = 0;
3324#endif
3325
3326 j = i = keep;
3327
3328 if (env->me_flags & MDB_WRITEMAP) {
3329 /* Clear dirty flags */
3330 while (++i <= pagecount) {
3331 dp = dl[i].mptr;
3332 /* Don't flush this page yet */
3333 if (dp->mp_flags & (P_LOOSE|P_KEEP)) {
3334 dp->mp_flags &= ~P_KEEP;
3335 dl[++j] = dl[i];
3336 continue;
3337 }
3338 dp->mp_flags &= ~P_DIRTY;
3339 }
3340 goto done;
3341 }
3342
3343 /* Write the pages */
3344 for (;;) {
3345 if (++i <= pagecount) {
3346 dp = dl[i].mptr;
3347 /* Don't flush this page yet */
3348 if (dp->mp_flags & (P_LOOSE|P_KEEP)) {
3349 dp->mp_flags &= ~P_KEEP;
3350 dl[i].mid = 0;
3351 continue;
3352 }
3353 pgno = dl[i].mid;
3354 /* clear dirty flag */
3355 dp->mp_flags &= ~P_DIRTY;
3356 pos = pgno * psize;
3357 size = psize;
3358 if (IS_OVERFLOW(dp)) size *= dp->mp_pages;
3359 }
3360#ifdef _WIN32
3361 else break;
3362
3363 /* Windows actually supports scatter/gather I/O, but only on
3364 * unbuffered file handles. Since we're relying on the OS page
3365 * cache for all our data, that's self-defeating. So we just
3366 * write pages one at a time. We use the ov structure to set
3367 * the write offset, to at least save the overhead of a Seek
3368 * system call.
3369 */
3370 DPRINTF(("committing page %"Z"u", pgno));
3371 memset(&ov, 0, sizeof(ov));
3372 ov.Offset = pos & 0xffffffff;
3373 ov.OffsetHigh = pos >> 16 >> 16;
3374 if (!WriteFile(env->me_fd, dp, size, NULL, &ov)) {
3375 rc = ErrCode();
3376 DPRINTF(("WriteFile: %d", rc));
3377 return rc;
3378 }
3379#else
3380 /* Write up to MDB_COMMIT_PAGES dirty pages at a time. */
3381 if (pos!=next_pos || n==MDB_COMMIT_PAGES || wsize+size>MAX_WRITE) {
3382 if (n) {
3383retry_write:
3384 /* Write previous page(s) */
3385#ifdef MDB_USE_PWRITEV
3386 wres = pwritev(env->me_fd, iov, n, wpos);
3387#else
3388 if (n == 1) {
3389 wres = pwrite(env->me_fd, iov[0].iov_base, wsize, wpos);
3390 } else {
3391retry_seek:
3392 if (lseek(env->me_fd, wpos, SEEK_SET) == -1) {
3393 rc = ErrCode();
3394 if (rc == EINTR)
3395 goto retry_seek;
3396 DPRINTF(("lseek: %s", strerror(rc)));
3397 return rc;
3398 }
3399 wres = writev(env->me_fd, iov, n);
3400 }
3401#endif
3402 if (wres != wsize) {
3403 if (wres < 0) {
3404 rc = ErrCode();
3405 if (rc == EINTR)
3406 goto retry_write;
3407 DPRINTF(("Write error: %s", strerror(rc)));
3408 } else {
3409 rc = EIO; /* TODO: Use which error code? */
3410 DPUTS("short write, filesystem full?");
3411 }
3412 return rc;
3413 }
3414 n = 0;
3415 }
3416 if (i > pagecount)
3417 break;
3418 wpos = pos;
3419 wsize = 0;
3420 }
3421 DPRINTF(("committing page %"Z"u", pgno));
3422 next_pos = pos + size;
3423 iov[n].iov_len = size;
3424 iov[n].iov_base = (char *)dp;
3425 wsize += size;
3426 n++;
3427#endif /* _WIN32 */
3428 }
3429
3430 /* MIPS has cache coherency issues, this is a no-op everywhere else
3431 * Note: for any size >= on-chip cache size, entire on-chip cache is
3432 * flushed.
3433 */
3434 CACHEFLUSH(env->me_map, txn->mt_next_pgno * env->me_psize, DCACHE);
3435
3436 for (i = keep; ++i <= pagecount; ) {
3437 dp = dl[i].mptr;
3438 /* This is a page we skipped above */
3439 if (!dl[i].mid) {
3440 dl[++j] = dl[i];
3441 dl[j].mid = dp->mp_pgno;
3442 continue;
3443 }
3444 mdb_dpage_free(env, dp);
3445 }
3446
3447done:
3448 i--;
3449 txn->mt_dirty_room += i - j;
3450 dl[0].mid = j;
3451 return MDB_SUCCESS;
3452}
3453
3454int
3455mdb_txn_commit(MDB_txn *txn)
3456{
3457 int rc;
3458 unsigned int i, end_mode;
3459 MDB_env *env;
3460
3461 if (txn == NULL)
3462 return EINVAL;
3463
3464 /* mdb_txn_end() mode for a commit which writes nothing */
3465 end_mode = MDB_END_EMPTY_COMMIT|MDB_END_UPDATE|MDB_END_SLOT|MDB_END_FREE;
3466
3467 if (txn->mt_child) {
3468 rc = mdb_txn_commit(txn->mt_child);
3469 if (rc)
3470 goto fail;
3471 }
3472
3473 env = txn->mt_env;
3474
3475 if (F_ISSET(txn->mt_flags, MDB_TXN_RDONLY)) {
3476 goto done;
3477 }
3478
3479 if (txn->mt_flags & (MDB_TXN_FINISHED|MDB_TXN_ERROR)) {
3480 DPUTS("txn has failed/finished, can't commit");
3481 if (txn->mt_parent)
3482 txn->mt_parent->mt_flags |= MDB_TXN_ERROR;
3483 rc = MDB_BAD_TXN;
3484 goto fail;
3485 }
3486
3487 if (txn->mt_parent) {
3488 MDB_txn *parent = txn->mt_parent;
3489 MDB_page **lp;
3490 MDB_ID2L dst, src;
3491 MDB_IDL pspill;
3492 unsigned x, y, len, ps_len;
3493
3494 /* Append our free list to parent's */
3495 rc = mdb_midl_append_list(&parent->mt_free_pgs, txn->mt_free_pgs);
3496 if (rc)
3497 goto fail;
3498 mdb_midl_free(txn->mt_free_pgs);
3499 /* Failures after this must either undo the changes
3500 * to the parent or set MDB_TXN_ERROR in the parent.
3501 */
3502
3503 parent->mt_next_pgno = txn->mt_next_pgno;
3504 parent->mt_flags = txn->mt_flags;
3505
3506 /* Merge our cursors into parent's and close them */
3507 mdb_cursors_close(txn, 1);
3508
3509 /* Update parent's DB table. */
3510 memcpy(parent->mt_dbs, txn->mt_dbs, txn->mt_numdbs * sizeof(MDB_db));
3511 parent->mt_numdbs = txn->mt_numdbs;
3512 parent->mt_dbflags[FREE_DBI] = txn->mt_dbflags[FREE_DBI];
3513 parent->mt_dbflags[MAIN_DBI] = txn->mt_dbflags[MAIN_DBI];
3514 for (i=CORE_DBS; i<txn->mt_numdbs; i++) {
3515 /* preserve parent's DB_NEW status */
3516 x = parent->mt_dbflags[i] & DB_NEW;
3517 parent->mt_dbflags[i] = txn->mt_dbflags[i] | x;
3518 }
3519
3520 dst = parent->mt_u.dirty_list;
3521 src = txn->mt_u.dirty_list;
3522 /* Remove anything in our dirty list from parent's spill list */
3523 if ((pspill = parent->mt_spill_pgs) && (ps_len = pspill[0])) {
3524 x = y = ps_len;
3525 pspill[0] = (pgno_t)-1;
3526 /* Mark our dirty pages as deleted in parent spill list */
3527 for (i=0, len=src[0].mid; ++i <= len; ) {
3528 MDB_ID pn = src[i].mid << 1;
3529 while (pn > pspill[x])
3530 x--;
3531 if (pn == pspill[x]) {
3532 pspill[x] = 1;
3533 y = --x;
3534 }
3535 }
3536 /* Squash deleted pagenums if we deleted any */
3537 for (x=y; ++x <= ps_len; )
3538 if (!(pspill[x] & 1))
3539 pspill[++y] = pspill[x];
3540 pspill[0] = y;
3541 }
3542
3543 /* Remove anything in our spill list from parent's dirty list */
3544 if (txn->mt_spill_pgs && txn->mt_spill_pgs[0]) {
3545 for (i=1; i<=txn->mt_spill_pgs[0]; i++) {
3546 MDB_ID pn = txn->mt_spill_pgs[i];
3547 if (pn & 1)
3548 continue; /* deleted spillpg */
3549 pn >>= 1;
3550 y = mdb_mid2l_search(dst, pn);
3551 if (y <= dst[0].mid && dst[y].mid == pn) {
3552 free(dst[y].mptr);
3553 while (y < dst[0].mid) {
3554 dst[y] = dst[y+1];
3555 y++;
3556 }
3557 dst[0].mid--;
3558 }
3559 }
3560 }
3561
3562 /* Find len = length of merging our dirty list with parent's */
3563 x = dst[0].mid;
3564 dst[0].mid = 0; /* simplify loops */
3565 if (parent->mt_parent) {
3566 len = x + src[0].mid;
3567 y = mdb_mid2l_search(src, dst[x].mid + 1) - 1;
3568 for (i = x; y && i; y--) {
3569 pgno_t yp = src[y].mid;
3570 while (yp < dst[i].mid)
3571 i--;
3572 if (yp == dst[i].mid) {
3573 i--;
3574 len--;
3575 }
3576 }
3577 } else { /* Simplify the above for single-ancestor case */
3578 len = MDB_IDL_UM_MAX - txn->mt_dirty_room;
3579 }
3580 /* Merge our dirty list with parent's */
3581 y = src[0].mid;
